exception.name: UpgradeNotPossibleException
exception.description: Before an upgrade is started it was found that the upgrade can not take place. A possible reason is that the upgrade package that is running in the node is not in the upgrade window of this upgrade package.

exception.name: UpgradeLogFileNotInUseException
exception.description:
The upgrade trace output is currently not directed to a file.
This is a property that can be changed in the trace property file (Trace_01.prop).

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The upgrade package is not installed.

enumMember.name: INSTALL_COMPLETED
enumMember.description: The upgrade package is completely installed.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_EXECUTING
enumMember.description: Upgrade is executing.

enumMember.name: AWAITING_CONFIRMATION
enumMember.description: The execution of upgrade needs confirmation before it proceeds.

enumMember.name: ONLY_DELETEABLE
enumMember.description: In this state an Upgrade Package can only be deleted. Its actions, when invoked, will throw the exception ActionNotAllowed.

enumMember.name: INSTALL_EXECUTING
enumMember.description: Installation of the upgrade package is executing.

enumMember.name: INSTALL_NOT_COMPLETED
enumMember.description: The upgrade package is not completely installed i.e. parts of it has been installed.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_COMPLETED
enumMember.description: The upgrade has been successfully executed.

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: No action is in progress.

enumMember.name: DOWNLOADING_FILES
enumMember.description: Downloading of files (load modules) in progress.

enumMember.name: SAVING_CV
enumMember.description: Saving a Configuration Version.

enumMember.name: RECONFIGURING_MOS
enumMember.description: Operation ReplaceConfigSupportMOs detected in upgrade.

enumMember.name: INITIATING_LOADER_INFO
enumMember.description: Trigger Initiate detected in upgrade sequence.

enumMember.name: PRELOADING
enumMember.description: Trigger Preload detected in upgrade sequence.

enumMember.name: APPLICATION_SPECIFIC_ACTION
enumMember.description: 'Unique trigger' for an application detected in upgrade sequence.

enumMember.name: FINISH_AND_CLEANING_UP
enumMember.description: The error handling is switched back to normal.

enumMember.name: EXECUTION_FAILED
enumMember.description: Indicates that the execution of an install or an upgrade action has failed.

enumMember.name: CANCEL_OF_INSTALLATION_IS_EXECUTING
enumMember.description: Indicates that cancellation of an ongoing installation is in progress.

enumMember.name: CANCEL_OF_INSTALLATION_FAILED
enumMember.description: Indicates that the execution of a cancel install action failed.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_UPGRADE
enumMember.description: The verifyUpgrade action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE
enumMember.description: An upgrade action (one of the variants) has been invoked.

enumMember.name: INSTALL
enumMember.description: An install action (one of the variants) has been invoked.

enumMember.name: CANCEL_INSTALL
enumMember.description: The cancelInstall action has been invoked.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description:
A timestamp.
Format: "Date: 2003-04-24, Time: 20:52:11.182"

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: This id is used to link more than one result to one action

enumMember.name: EXECUTED
enumMember.description:
The invoked action has been successfully executed without warnings.One of three possible main results of executed action.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UNSPECIFIED
enumMember.description:
A not specified error/ warning has been detected (see additional info for further details)
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_CHECKSUM_VER_FAILED
enumMember.description:
A load module checksum verification has failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NOT_ENOUGH_AVAIL_DISK_SPACE
enumMember.description:
There is not enough available disk space for the required number of new CVs (configuration versions) to be created automatically during an upgrade.
Value valid for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: MAX_NO_CV_WILL_BE_EXCEEDED
enumMember.description:
The maximum number of allowed CVs (configuration versions) will be exceeded if the required number of new CVs is created automatically during an upgrade.
Value valid for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_FROM_CURRENT_UP_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The Upgrade Window element in the Upgrade Control File does not specify the current Upgrade Package as a valid 'upgrade from' version.
Value valid for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NON_SUPPORTED_PIU
enumMember.description:
A non supported Plug In Unit (PIU) has been detected i.e. the PIU in the node is not defined in the Upgrade Control File. This is not a fault that prevents an upgrade from being executed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: FAULTY_PIU
enumMember.description:
A faulty Plug In Unit (PIU) has been detected. This is not a fault that prevents an upgrade from being executed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: CREATION_OF_CV_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The auto-creation of an install CV failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The requested action is not allowed due to an other action already is in progress for an other UP MO.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: INSTALLATION_MANUALLY_CANCELLED
enumMember.description:
An ongoing installation has been cancelled (aborted) due to request from client.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_NOT_ACCESSIBLE
enumMember.description:
The FTP server to be used for downloads of load modules is not accessible.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: INSUFFICIENT_DISK_SPACE_FOR_LOAD_MODULES
enumMember.description:
The required disk space for load modules to be installed is insufficient.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_IP_ADDRESS_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected in the IP address of the FTP server.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: DELTA_INSTALL_MERGE_ERROR
enumMember.description:
The install of the delta Upgrade Control File (UCF) failed i.e. the analysis of the delta UCF together with current active UP's UCF failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: SELECTIVE_INSTALL_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected during the selection phase of an install.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: EXECUTION_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The execution of invoked action failed.One of three possible main results of executed action.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS
enumMember.description:
The action has been successfully executed but with warnings.One of three possible main results of executed action.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE

exception.name: FtpServerNotAccessibleException
exception.description: Ftp server is not accessible. This may depend on erroneous IP address, username, password, or that the IP communication with the Ftp server is down, or that the Ftp server itself is malfunctioning.

exception.name: GetFileException
exception.description: An error was encountered during FTP get file. A filePath in the upgradeControlFile may be inconsistent with a filepath on the Ftp server.

structMember.name: tag
structMember.description: The tag is used as a reference between the PiuType MO and the Repertoire MO to find out how to create the program object under a PlugInUnit MO.

structMember.name: subParentLDN
structMember.description:
Local distinguished name of the program parent from the PlugInUnit.
Example: 1. "Spu=1,Spm=2" (the program is to be created under: ...PlugInUnit=2,Spu=1,Spm=2") 2. "" (empty string - the program is to be created directly under the PlugInUnit)

structMember.name: programMoTypeName
structMember.description: The name of the Program MO that will be created.

structMember.name: loadableProcessorName
structMember.description: The loadableProcessorName is a user friendly name of the processor.

struct.name: RepertoireLoadModuleData
struct.description: This structure contains load module data that belongs to a piu type.

structMember.name: loadModuleDN
structMember.description: The distinguished name of the load module, which is needed and sufficient to convert the load module to a real object reference.

structMember.name: tag
structMember.description: The tag is used as a reference between the PiuType MO and the Repertoire MO to find out how to create the program object under a PlugInUnit MO.

enum.name: RPUSwitchOverMode
enum.description:
This attribute can have the following values:
AtPiuFault = Indicates the MP (where the normal RPU is configured) is faulty (HW error). This is the default value.
AtPiuRestart = Indicates the MP (where the normal RPU is configured) is restarted.

enum.name: RPUNormalisationMode
enum.description:
This enumeration can have the following values:
Manual = Indicates that no normalisation is performed by cello until the operator issues a "switch" action.
Automatic = Indicates that Cello performs the normalisation automatically, after the failed RPU is available again. This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUReplicationMode
enum.description:
This enumaration contains the following values:
Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
Never = Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enumMember.name: Always
enumMember.description: Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: Never
enumMember.description: Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: AtShutdown
enumMember.description: AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: ApplControlled
enumMember.description: ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUOperationalMode
enum.description:
This enumeration contains the following values:
AsConfigured = The RSHs runs as the RPU is configured. SwitchOver = The RSHs has been switched over. Unavailable = No RSHs, that uses this RPU, are running.

struct.name: AirFlowData
struct.description: Control value for the fan unit. Needed by cooling function.

structMember.name: normalLowTempAirFlow
structMember.description: Control value for the fan unit running in normal autonomous mode. This parameter is the subrack/fanunit airflow value that is required to achieve sufficient cooling at 20 degree centigrade or lower ambient temperature of the most demanding plug in unit (PIU) in the subrack. This airflow value shall be sufficient (but not unnecessarily large) to secure that no "normal overtemp" fault indication is issued. Default values = 250 m3/h. (value >=0)

structMember.name: normalHighTempAirFlow
structMember.description: Control value for the fan unit running in normal autonomous mode. This parameter is the subrack/fanunit airflow value that is required to achieve sufficient cooling at 50 degree centigrade ambient temperature of the most demanding plug in unit (PIU) in the subrack. This airflow value shall be sufficient (but not unnecessarily large) to secure that no "normal overtemp" fault indication is issued. Default values = 400 m3/h. (value >=0)

structMember.name: noiseReducedLowTempAirFlow
structMember.description: Control value for the fan unit running in noise reduction mode. This parameter is the subrack/fanunit airflow value that is required to achieve sufficient cooling at 20 degree centigrade or lower ambient temperature of the most demanding plug in unit (PIU) in the subrack. This airflow value shall be sufficient (but not unnecessarily large) to secure that no "exceptional overtemp" fault indication is issued Default values = 250 m3/h. (value >=0)

structMember.name: noiseReducedHighTempAirFlow
structMember.description: Control value for the fan unit running in noise reduction mode. This parameter is the subrack/fanunit airflow value that is required to achieve sufficient cooling at 50 degree centigrade ambient temperature of the most demanding plug in unit (PIU) in the subrack. This airflow value shall be sufficient (but not unnecessarily large) to secure that no "exceptional overtemp" fault indication is issued. Default values = 400 m3/h. (value >=0)

exception.name: IpAddressException

exception.name: AueFailureException
exception.description: An application upgrade engine has reported a failure.

exception.name: ActionNotAllowedException

The action is not allowed, the UpgradePackage MO is in wrong state.
For example if you try 'upgrade()' before an 'install()' or 'forcedInstall()' has been done.

exception.name: CVFileSystemErrorException
exception.description: Exception thrown upon file system Error.

exception.name: CVDBErrorException

exception.name: CVLLPErrorException
exception.description: LLP Error Exception (error when creating ARMAMENT and LLP.LMID files).

exception.name: CVAlreadyExistsException
exception.description: The configuration version already exists (e.g. message at create).

exception.name: CVDoesNotExistsException
exception.description: The configuration version does not exist (e.g. message at setCVAsStartable).

exception.name: CVDeleteNotAllowedException
exception.description: It is not allowed to delete the configuration version, because it is in use (used as startable or in rollback list).

exception.name: CVInvalidCVException
exception.description: The configuration version is not valid (due to missing files).

exception.name: CVFormatErrorException
exception.description:
Format Error in given configuration version name.
The following characters are allowed within the name: [0-9], [A-Z], [a-z] and '&','%',':','.','_', '-'
Note! For comment and operatorName spaces (' ') are also allowed within the strings.

exception.name: CVErrorException

exception.name: CVActivityLogFilePathErrorException

exception.name: CV_MaxNumberOfInstancesException

exception.name: InvalidPriorityException
exception.description: Indicates an invalid priority level, i.e. the priority in question is out of the defined range.

struct.name: QoSProfileClassA
struct.description: This struct contains the values applicable for QoS Class A.

structMember.name: boundOnProbOfDelay
structMember.description:
Represents the upper bound on the probability that the delay in the node exceeds the delay limit given by the attribute "boundOnNodeDelay".
Unit is 1/1000000000.

structMember.name: boundOnProbOfLoss
structMember.description:
Represents the upper bound of the cell loss probability in the current node.
Unit is 1/1000000000.

structMember.name: boundOnNodeDelay
structMember.description: The upper bound on the delay (delay=queueing and serving of Aal2 packets in an Aal2 mux + delay on ATM layer) through the current node. Unit is micro seconds.

enumMember.name: free
enumMember.description: It is free to be pre-configured with a new PlugInUnit.

enumMember.name: used
enumMember.description: A PlugInUnit is inserted in the slot or the slot is pre-configured with a PlugInUnit.

enumMember.name: coveredByPiu
enumMember.description: Currently not supported.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
The product number of the product or document.
Examples: ABC 101 001, CXC 123 456, 1/BFD 101 999
In the case of UpgradePackage this is the document number of the upgrade package.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
The revision of the product number.
Examples: R1, r1a, R1A02, P7B

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description: A user-friendly name of the product.

structMember.name: productInfo
structMember.description: User-friendly information about the product.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date can be represented in two ways.
1) The preferable syntax is a four-digit representation of the year, and a two-digit representation of the month and a two-digit representation of the day. The numbers of characters in this case, is eight. Example: 19991231
2) The date can also consist of two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week and two digits for the number of week. The numbers of characters in this case, is five. Example: 99W12

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description: A user-friendly name of the product.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
Unique identity for each product, which is constituted by the Ericsson product number (ABC number).
The maximum number of characters for a product number is 24 including 2 slashes, 2 spaces and 2 characters for origination notation.
Example of product number: ABC 101 001 (1/ABC 101 01/1234) 123/ABCDE 101 1010/12345
.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
Indicates the revision state of the product. It consists of a letter R or P, one or two digits and/or one or two letters. The maximum number of characters is four inclusive R or P. Example: R1A, R1A02, P7B
A suffix may be added to the revision state. The suffix may consists of one or two digits or one letter.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number consists of 13 alphanumerical characters grouped as 6 plus 7 characters. The first 6 characters are to be used for factory codes and the last 7 characters are used for an individual number or batch number.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date can be represented in two ways.
1) The preferable syntax is a four-digit representation of the year, and a two-digit representation of the month and a two-digit representation of the day. The numbers of characters in this case, is eight. Example: 19991231
2) The date can also consist of two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week and two digits for the number of week. The numbers of characters in this case, is five. Example: 99W12

enum.name: LoadClass
enum.description: Defines the phase in the load and start sequence.

enumMember.name: mp
enumMember.description: The board is a Main processor.

enumMember.name: bp
enumMember.description: The board is a device board.

enumMember.name: others
enumMember.description: The board is not a Main processor or a device board.

enum.name: RestartCause
enum.description: This attribute indicates the restart cause of plugInUnit. The defined values are: 1. piuRestartError: restart because of error. 2. piuRestartUpgrade: restart because of system upgrade.

enumMember.name: piuRestartUpgrade
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates that the Piu restart cause is upgrade.

enumMember.name: piuRestartError
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates that the Piu restart cause is error.

enum.name: FanState
enum.description: The Fan can be in one of three controlling state: - standalone: not manageable, full speed fans - autonomous: manageable, air-flow control - noiseReduced: time-limited low speed fan

enumMember.name: standalone
enumMember.description: It's running on itself, not manageable.

enumMember.name: autonomous
enumMember.description: Manageable state.

enumMember.name: noiseReduced
enumMember.description: Temporary state with reduced cooling.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_NO_LIMITS
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates unlimited restarts and no faulty marking of the PIU. Used for critical PIU's such as TUBs, SCBs and some ET-boards.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_WARM
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -warm -refresh -cold -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_REFRESH
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -refresh -cold -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_COLD
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_FAULT_MARKED
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

exception.description: Exception that is thrown when a FRO (Facade Resource Object in the resource layer) cannot be accessed.

exception.name: FroRequestFailedException
exception.description: Exception that is thrown when the result of a request to a FRO (Facade Resource Object in the resource layer) is not ok.

exception.name: MoReservedByOtherUserException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the MO is already reserved by another user (MO).

exception.name: MoHasChildrenException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an MO is requested to be deleted, but the MO has children, which must be deleted first.

exception.name: MoReservedNotDeletableException
exception.description: Exception thrown when trying to delete an MO that is reserved by another MO (user).

exception.name: MaxNumberExceededException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the maximum number of childrens for an MO is exceeded.

exception.name: AttrValueNotUniqueException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a value of an attribute is not unique.

exception.name: TransactionRequiredException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an MO is accessed outside a transaction but the access method requires a transaction.

exception.name: ValueOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be set, but the requested value is not accepted.

exception.name: WrongAttributeTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be set, but the requested value is of the wrong type.

exception.name: NotHandledAttributeTypeException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an attribute of not handled type is requested.

exception.name: NoSuchFieldException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when a Struct is accessed but the reqested Struct element is not found.

exception.name: NoSuchAttributeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be accessed but the access method for the is not defined (the attribute can not be accessed)

exception.name: MoCardinalityViolationException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when the creation of an MO fails due to child - parent cardinality violation. The cardinality is specified in the MIM.

exception.name: IllegalParentException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the parent of the MO is of the wrong type.

exception.name: AttrNotSettableAtCreateException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a create is ordered with attribute values that are not settable at create.

exception.name: AttrMissingAtCreateException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an attribute that is mandatory at create is missing.

exception.name: MoNameAlreadyTakenException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO is created and the distinguished name of the MO is already in use.

exception.name: IllegalArgumentTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown if the argument supplied is of the wrong type, for example in an action.

exception.name: IllegalAttributeValueException
exception.description: Exception thrown if the value of the attribute is not valid.

enum.name: AvailabilityStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

exception.name: InvalidMoReferenceException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the submitted MO reference is invalid.

exception.name: FroNotLockedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a fRo cannot be accessed.

exception.name: GeneralErrorException
exception.description: Exception thrown by an MO when there is a general error.

exception.name: IdentityNotAllowedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an identity (LDN) specified at create is not allowed.

exception.name: IllegalMoTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a reference to an MO is of a unexpected/wrong MO type.

exception.name: ImpossibleCollectAtmInfoException
exception.description: Exception thrown when gathering of ATM info fails.

exception.name: MoCanNotBeDeletedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not possible to delete an MO.

exception.name: MoNotPossibleToReserveException
exception.description: Exception thrown when by an MO if its not possible to reserve the MO.

exception.name: MoNotReservedByUserException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a user tries to release an MO that is not reserved by this user.

exception.name: NoDiskException
exception.description: Exception thrown when there is no hard disk.

exception.name: RemovalFailedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an element cannot be removed from a sequence.

exception.name: RestartRejectedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when restart of the PlugInUnit is not allowed.

enum.name: SyncMode
enum.description: The Sync Mode Operation of the node.

structMember.name: suermT

structMember.name: suermD
structMember.description: SUREM parameter D. Measurement units are in SUs.

structMember.name: suermN
structMember.description: SUERM parameter N. Measurement units are in SUs.

structMember.name: tin
structMember.description:
Normal AERM threshold, Tin. Number of signal errors that cause abortion of a normal proving peroid.
Measurement units are SUs.

structMember.name: tie
structMember.description:
Emergency AERM threshold, Tie. Number of signal units errors that cause abortion of an emergency proving period.

structMember.name: provings

structMember.name: timerT2

structMember.name: timerT3
structMember.description:
Maximum time to stay in Aligned state before signalling link failure.

structMember.name: timerT4n

Length of the normal proving period.

structMember.name: timerT4e

enum.name: EmergencyStatus
enum.description: This enumeration specifies the different stages of the emergency state.

enumMember.name: NEVER_USED
enumMember.description: Emergency state has not been activated since installation of license key file.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: All capacity restrictions removed and all features enabled. The maximum time in this state is 7 days.

enumMember.name: USE_DEGRADED
enumMember.description: A new license key file has to be istalled in order not to jopardize future use and performance. The maximum time in this state is 7 days.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE_AGAIN
enumMember.description: All features enabled again for a maximum period of 7 days then a new license key file has to be installed in order to be able to use this node.

enumMember.name: USE_DISABLED
enumMember.description: Use of the node is no longer allowed since no new license key file has been installed.

struct.name: EmergencyInfo
struct.description:
This attribute provides information about the current EmergencyState.
Note: for the states NEVER_USED and USE_DISABLED the return value for time is insignificant.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The current emergency state of the license server.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description:
This attribute holds information on the time elapsed in this state.
Note: The time out values for the states ALL_OPEN, DEGADED and PROLONGED is 7 days. The unit for this attribute is seconds. 1 day = 86400 seconds 7 days = 604800 seconds.

enumMember.name: WARM_AT_PIU_RESTART
enumMember.description: Warm node restart at restart of the last PIU.

enumMember.name: COLD_AT_PIU_RESTART
enumMember.description: Cold node restart at restart of the last PIU.

enumMember.name: WARM_AT_PIU_FAULT
enumMember.description: Warm node restart at fault mark of the last PIU.

enumMember.name: COLD_AT_PIU_FAULT
enumMember.description: Cold node restart at fault mark of the last PIU.

structMember.name: maxPD
structMember.description:
Maximum number of SD PDUs before a poll is sent.
maxPD < initialCredit

structMember.name: maxStat
structMember.description:
Maximum number, odd integer value, of list elements placed in a STAT PDU.
Note: The maxStat attribute is dependent on the AAL5 maximum SDU size defined in the Aal5TpVccTp MO. The maxStat times 4 (octets) plus additional 12 octets (for header) must not exceed the AAL5 maximum SDU size (lower of the two directions, fromUserMaxSduSize and toUserMaxSduSize). The consistency control is not performed until the UniSaalTp MO is created since there is no relation between the UniSaalProfile MO and the Aal5TpVccTp MO.

structMember.name: initialCredit
structMember.description:
Initial number of credits.
Note: For 64 kbit/s use 30.
Note! The value for initialCredit must be larger than the value of maxPD.

structMember.name: timerKeepAlive
structMember.description: Timer to be used during a period of no outstanding acknowledgements or new data pending receipt of credit. At timeout the peer is polled to see if it is alive. The timer determines the interval between polls in transient phase. This timer should be greater than the roundtripdelay and also greater than timerpoll. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerNoResponse
structMember.description: Timer to determine the maximum time interval during which at least one STAT PDU reception is expected as a response to a poll. This timer should be equal to timerKeepAlive+roundtripdelay. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerIdle
structMember.description: Timer running when there are no PDUs to transmit and there are no outstanding acknowledgements or data pending for credit. When this timer is running, no POLL PDUs are sent. This timer should be significantly greater than timerKeepAlive value. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerCC
structMember.description: Timer determining the time between re-transmission of PDUs: BGN, END, ER, RS. Should be slightly more than the roundtripdelay. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerPoll
structMember.description: Timer that specifies the maximum time between sending of POLL PDUs to the peer receiver during other traffic (active phase). Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: maxCC
structMember.description: Maximum number of re-transmissions of PDUs: BGN, END, ER, RS. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: congestionOnSet
structMember.description:
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer that must be filled in order to cause congestion. Congestion is notified to the users of this protocol layer. The part of the buffer above the congestion level is used to take care of messages that were sent before the users stopped sending.
This attribute should follow the rule 0 <= congestationAbatement < congestationOnSet <= 100.

structMember.name: congestionAbatement
structMember.description:
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer for which congestion is stopped. If the congestionAbatement level is lesser but almost equal to congestionOnSet, congestion alarms might be raised and ceased very often.
This attribute should follow the rule 0 <= congestationAbatement < congestationOnSet <= 100.

struct.name: NniSaalProfileData
struct.description:
Struct holding the values for an NniSaalProfile.
NOTE: Congestition Level 1 - 3 is supported.

structMember.name: timerPoll
structMember.description: Timer that specifies the maximum time between sending of POLL PDUs to the peer receiver during other traffic (active phase). Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: maxCC
structMember.description: Maximum number of re-transmissions of PDUs: BGN, END, ER, RS.

structMember.name: maxPD
structMember.description:
Maximum number of SD PDUs before a poll is sent.
maxPD < initialCredit

structMember.name: maxStat
structMember.description:
Maximum number, odd integer value, of list elements placed in a STAT PDU.
Note: The maxStat attribute is controlled by the AAL5 maximum SDU size defined in the Aal5TpVccTp MO. The maxStat times 4 (octets) plus additional 12 octets (for header) must not exceed the AAL5 maximum SDU size (lower of the two directions, fromUserMaxSduSize and toUserMaxSduSize).
The consistency control is not performed until the NniSaalTp MO is created since there is no relation between the NniSaalProfile MO and the Aal5TpVccTp MO.

structMember.name: initialCredit
structMember.description:
Initial number of credits.
Note: For 64 kbit/s use 30.
Note! The value for initialCredit must be larger than the value of maxPD.

structMember.name: timerKeepAlive
structMember.description: Timer to be used during a period of no outstanding acknowledgements or new data pending receipt of credit. At timeout the peer is polled to see if it is alive. The timer determines the interval between polls in transient phase. This timer should be greater than the roundtripdelay and also greater than timerpoll. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerNoResponse
structMember.description: Timer to determine the maximum time interval during which at least one STAT PDU reception is expected as a response to a poll.This timer should be equal to timerKeepAlive+roundtripdelay. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerIdle
structMember.description: Timer running when there are no PDUs to transmit and there are no outstanding acknowledgements or data pending for credit. When this timer is running, no POLL PDUs are sent. This timer should be significantly greater than timerKeepAlive value. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerCC
structMember.description: Timer determining the time between re-transmission of PDUs: BGN, END, ER, RS. Time unit = milliseconds. Should be more than the roundtrip delay.

structMember.name: mps
structMember.description: Management Proving Status which is used to decide if proving is done or not during SAAL connection setup.

structMember.name: congestionLevel1OnSet
structMember.description:
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer that must be filled in order to cause congestion. Congestion is notified to the users of this protocol layer. The part of the buffer above the congestion level is used to take care of messages that were sent before the users stopped sending.
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer that must be filled in order to cause congestion. Congestion is notified to the users of this protocol layer. The part of the buffer above the congestion level is used to take care of messages that were sent before the users stopped sending.
This attribute should follow the rule 0 <= congestationLevel1OnSet <= congestationLevel2OnSet <= congestationLevel3OnSet <= 100.

structMember.name: congestionLevel2OnSet
structMember.description:
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer that must be filled in order to cause congestion. Congestion is notified to the users of this protocol layer. The part of the buffer above the congestion level is used to take care of messages that were sent before the users stopped sending.
This attribute should follow the rule 0 <= congestationLevel1OnSet <= congestationLevel2OnSet <= congestationLevel3OnSet <= 100.

structMember.name: congestionLevel3OnSet
structMember.description:
Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer that must be filled in order to cause congestion. Congestion is notified to the users of this protocol layer. The part of the buffer above the congestion level is used to take care of messages that were sent before the users stopped sending.
This attribute should follow the rule 0 <= congestationLevel1OnSet <= congestationLevel2OnSet <= congestationLevel3OnSet <= 100.

structMember.name: congestionLevel1Abatement
structMember.description: Attribute specifying the percentage of the buffer for which congestionLevel1 is stopped. If the congestionAbatement level is lesser but almost equal to congestionOnSet, congestion alarms might be raised and ceased very often.

structMember.name: nrOfPDUsDuringProving
structMember.description:
The length of proving in terms of number of transmitted PDUs (n1). noOfPDUsDuringProving x T3 < T2
For the TTC standard the only allowed value is 0 (which means no proving).

structMember.name: maxNRP
structMember.description: State variable which defines max number of retransmissions of PDUs during proving to consider proving successful.

structMember.name: timerNoCredit
structMember.description: Maximum time of no credit. If the timer expires, the assured data transfer mode is released.

structMember.name: timerRepeatSrec
structMember.description: Timer which is set whenever a report of SSCOP recovery is received from the SSCF. If the timer is running when another report of recovery is received, the assured data transfer mode is released. If the timer expires, nothing is done. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerT1
structMember.description: Timer between the link release action and the next link re-establish action during the alignment. At expiry of timer T1, a new attempt to setup assured data transfer mode to the peer is done. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerT2
structMember.description: Total time that SSCF will attempt alignment. At expiry of timer T2, the alignment procedure will be interrupted. Time unit = milliseconds.

structMember.name: timerT3
structMember.description: Time between proving PDUs. The timer is set such that loading of the signalling link is approximately 50% of its nominal rate. Time unit = milliseconds.

exception.name: ListOfTimeSlotsNotUniqueException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a time slot appears more than once in the time slot list.

enum.name: RefActivity
enum.description:
RefActivity can have the following values:
inactive = Synchronization reference is currently not used in system clock generation. active = Synchronization is used in system clock generation.

enum.name: RefState
enum.description: RefState can have the following values: failed = synchronization reference is not capable to perform its required tasks. degraded = capability of synchronization reference to perform its required tasks is degraded e.g. because of signal level degradation. This value is only applicable for traffic carrying (ET physical path termination) synchronization references. Note: attribute degradationIsFault controls whether synchronization reference degradation is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault or not. lossOfTracking = system clock regulation algorithm on TU board can not follow the 8kHz synchronization reference signal either because of the poor quality of the signal or because of a HW fault at TU board. If all synchronization references repeatedly end up to state lossOfTracking, fault is likely in TU HW. ok = synchronization reference is capable of performing its required tasks.

enum.name: FaultCriteria
enum.description: FaultCriteria can have the following values: degrNotFault = synchronization reference degradation is NOT interpreted as a synchronization reference fault. degrIsFault = synchronization reference degradation is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault.

enum.name: ClockState
enum.description: ClockState can have the following values: startUp = locked = system clock signal on Timing Unit is locked: a synchronization reference is used in the system clock generation, clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better. holdOver = system clock signal on Timing Unit is hold-over: no synchronization reference is used in system clock generation, clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better. freeRunning = system clock signal on Timing Unit is free running: no synchronization reference is used in system clock generation, clock accuracy is 4.6 ppm or better. failed = system clock signal on Timing Unit is failed: fault in system clock generation function, no quarantee of clock accuracy level. not Applicable = system clock signal on Timing Unit is not applicable: TU board not present.

exception.name: AlreadyRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an object is already registered.

exception.name: MaxNoOfRefRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the maximum number of references is reached.

exception.name: PriorityAlreadyInUseException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a priority is already in use.

exception.name: PriorityOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the priority is out of range.

exception.name: NotPermittedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an reference is not valid, null or of incorrect type.

exception.name: NotRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when trying to de-register an object that is not registered in the database.

exception.name: NotUniqueFroIdException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a fro Id is not unique.

enum.name: SwitchReliableGroup
enum.description: A predefined group consisting of working links and their corresponding protecting links. These links form the n+m link redundancy.

enumMember.name: physicalLinkStatusWorking
enumMember.description: Defines physical link status.

enumMember.name: physicalLinkStatusProtecting
enumMember.description: Defines physical link status.

enumMember.name: physicalLinkStatusUndefined
enumMember.description: Defines physical link status.

structMember.name: indicator
structMember.description:
Global title indicator should have following values for both ITU and TTC:
The values for the GT Indicator
Value Comment
0 No new global title 2 TT only 3 TT-NP-ES 4 TT-NP-ES-NOA
Explanation:
TT = translation type NP = numbering plan ES = encoding scheme NOA = nature of address indication

structMember.name: natureOfAddress
structMember.description:
Indicates number type, i.e. national or international number. Coding of the Nature Address:
0 = "unknown" 1 = "Subscriber number" 2 = "Reserved for national use" 3 = "National significant number" 4 = "International number"

structMember.name: numberingPlan
structMember.description:
Indicates which numbering plan that is used.
Coding of the Numbering Plan:
0 = "Unknown" 1 = "ISDN/Telephony Numbering Plan" 3 = "Data Numbering Plan" 4 = "Telex Numbering Plan" 5 = "Maritime Mobile Numbering Plan" 6 = "Land Mobile Numbering Plan" 7 = "ISDN/Mobile Numbering Plan"

structMember.name: translationType
structMember.description: Used to direct the message to the appropriate Global Title translation function.

structMember.name: addressInformation
structMember.description: Digit string of 1-37 digits, where each digit is 0-9, and B, C. B and C are for Code 11 and Code 12. The addressInformation may also contain wild card symbols: "*" or "?". Wild cards are only allowed for defining Global Title Translations, they are not allowed for specifying SCCP SAPs (built with SPC and Global Title or SPC + SSN + Global Title).

structMember.name: encodingScheme
structMember.description:
Indicates if the number of address signals are an odd or even number, and is coded as follows:
0 = "Unknown" 1 = "BCD, odd number of digits" 2 = "BCD, even number of digits"
Other values in the encoding scheme will result in the error "Wrong Nature Of Address", (Routing failure reason=No translation for an address of such nature).

enumMember.name: loadShare
enumMember.description: The when sharing mode is set to loadShare the SCCP traffic is load shared between the two entities (access points).

enumMember.name: dupliDominant
enumMember.description: When the sharing mode is set to dupliDominant the second entity (access point) is a backup for the first entity.

enum.name: EncodingScheme
enum.description: Possible values for number signalling.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Unkown encoding scheme.

enumMember.name: ODD_NUMBER
enumMember.description: BCD, odd number of digits.

enumMember.name: EVEN_NUMBER
enumMember.description: BCD, even number of digits.

enum.name: GlobalTitleIndicator
enum.description:
Global title indicator values for China, ITU, TTC and ANSI.
Note: China, ITU and TCC will use TT_ONLY, TT_NP_ES, TT_NP_ES_NOA, NOA_ONLY.
ANSI will use: ANSI_TT_NP_ES = 5 ANSI_TT_ONLY = 6

enumMember.name: TT_ONLY
enumMember.description:
Translation Type only.
Only valid for China, ITU and TTC.

enumMember.name: TT_NP_ES
enumMember.description:
Translation Type, Numbering Plan and Encoding Scheme.
Only valid for China, ITU and TTC.

enumMember.name: TT_NP_ES_NOA
enumMember.description:
Translation Type, Numbering Plan, Encoding Scheme, and Nature Of Address indication.
Only valid for China, ITU and TTC.

enumMember.name: NOA_ONLY
enumMember.description:
Nature of Address indicator only.
Only valid for China, ITU and TTC.

enumMember.name: ANSI_TT_NP_ES
enumMember.description:
Translation Type, Numbering Plan and Encoding Scheme.
Only valid for ANSI.

enumMember.name: ANSI_TT_ONLY
enumMember.description:
Translation Type only.
Only valid for ANSI.

structMember.name: sendSST
structMember.description:
Controls when to send SST (SCCP Subsystem Test message).
0 = Wait for tStatInfo timer to expire once after MTP_RESUME before sending SST. 1 = Send SST immediately after MTP_RESUME, then start tStatInfo timer.

structMember.name: sendSSA
structMember.description:
Controls when to send SSA (SCCP Subsystem Allowed message).
0 = Do not send SSA when client attaches, wait until SST is received. (default for ANSI/CHINA/ITU/TTC) 1 = Send SSA immediately when client attaches.

structMember.name: sendSSP
structMember.description:
Controls whether to send SSP (SCCP Subsystem Prohibited message).
0 = Do not send SSP when client detaches. (default for TTC) 1 = Send SSP immediately when client detaches. (default for ANSI/CHINA/ITU)

structMember.name: useSST
structMember.description:
Controls whether to send SST messages or not (SCCP Subsystem Test message).
0 = Send SST as indicated by sendSST. (default for ANSI/CHINA/ITU) 1 = (not used) 2 = (not used) 3 = Do not initiate SST messages at all, ie. do not start timer tStatInfo nor send any SST at MTP_RESUME. (default for TTC)

structMember.name: allowRemoteBroadcast
structMember.description:
Controls the remote broadcast.
0 = allow remote broadcast. (default for ANSI/CHINA/ITU/TTC) 1 = do not allow remote broadcast

structMember.name: initiateTimerTcon
structMember.description:
Controls whether to initiate hardcoded congestion timer or not.
0 = start timer when SSC is received. (default for CHINA/ITU/TTC) 1 = do not start timer
Note! This attribute is not valid for the ANSI standard.

enum.name: J1Type
enum.description: J1Type can have the following values: J1_G = 0 according to TTC JT-G703/G704 J1_I = 1 according to TCC JT-I431

enumMember.name: j1_I

struct.name: Mtp3bSpItuPriorityData
struct.description: Priority attributes for MTP3b SP of the ITU standard.

structMember.name: prioSlt
structMember.description:
The prioSlt attribute sets the priority for the Signalling Link Test Message and Acknowledge (SLTM / SLTA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioCo
structMember.description:
The prioCo attribute sets the priority for the ChangeOver Order and Acknowledge (COO/COA) or eXtended Change over Order and Acknowledge (XCO/XCA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet)
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioCb
structMember.description:
The prioCb attribute sets the priority for the Change Back Declaration and Acknowledge (CBD / CBA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioEc
structMember.description:
The prioEc attribute sets the priority for the Emergency Change over Order and Acknowledge (ECO / ECA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioRst
structMember.description:
The prioRst attribute sets the priority for the signalling Route Set Test (RST) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioTra
structMember.description:
The prioTra attribute sets the priority for the Traffic Restart Allowed signal (TRA) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioUpu
structMember.description:
The prioUpu attribute sets the priority for the User Part Unavailable (UPU) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

structMember.name: prioLink
structMember.description:
The prioLink attribute sets the priority for link related messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. The messages are :
Link INhibit (LIN), Link UNinhibit (LUN), Link Inhibit Denied (LID), Link Inhibit Acknowledge (LIA), Link Uninhibit Acknowledge (LUA), Link Forced Uninhibit (LFU), Link Local inhibit Test (LLT) and Link Remote inhibit Test (LRT)
When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).
lowest:0 low:1 high:2 highest:3

struct.name: Mtp3bSpItuTimerData
struct.description: ITU timers for MTP3bSpItu. Timervalues in 1/10 s (deciseconds).

structMember.name: timerT1
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on changeover.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT2
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for a COO or a COA.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT3
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on a time controlled diversion change back.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT4
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for CBA, first attempt.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT5
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for CBA, second attempt
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT6
structMember.description:
Timer for delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on controlled rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT8
structMember.description:
Timer for delay to prohibit sending of TFP messages via the response method. This is a STP specific parameter, which is ignored when configured as an endpoint.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT10
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting to repeat sending of RST periodically.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT12
structMember.description:
Waiting for uninhibit acknowledgement.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT13
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for force uninhibit.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT14
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for inhibition acknowledgement.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT17
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid oscillation of initial alignment failure and link restart.
The value for this timer should be less than the value for timerT2.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTBsnt
structMember.description:
Waiting for BSNT value from MTP-2 or SAAL (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTRetrieval
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for completion of buffer retrieval from MTP-2 or SAAL (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTStart
structMember.description:
Timer for retransmission of DL_START_req if no answer received. Started when timerT17 expires. (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTc
structMember.description:
Controlling the period a route set is considered congested when a Transfer Controlled message has been received.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT18
structMember.description:
Supervision timer for the first phase of a restarting STP. This is an STP specific parameter, which is ignored when configured as an endpoint.
The value for this timer should be less than the value for timerT2.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT19
structMember.description:
Controlling the response of the receipt of a traffic restart message from an adjacent node.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT20
structMember.description:
Overall MTP restart timer at the restarting MTP.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT21
structMember.description:
Overall MTP restart timer at an adjacent signalling point to a restarting MTP.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT22
structMember.description:
Local inhibit test timer.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT23
structMember.description:
Remote inhibit test timer.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerSlta
structMember.description:
Supervision timer for SLTA message (time within SLTA should arrive).
Timer T1 in ITU Q.707 standard.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerSltm
structMember.description:
Timer for sending SLTM periodically.
Timer T2 in ITU Q.707 standard.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaTack
structMember.description:
Timer used for message acknowledgement.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaPeriodicAudit
structMember.description:
Timer used for audit procedure.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT1
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing of messages when an association fails.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT3
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing of messages when an association becomes active.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT6
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing on controlled rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT8
structMember.description:
Delay to prohibit sending of DUNA messages via the response method.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT40
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on controlled/forced rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT41
structMember.description:
Timer controlloing the traffic activation delay during restart phase.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT42
structMember.description:
The forever interval period for trying association after an unsiccessfull trial.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaTc
structMember.description:
Timer controlling the period a route set is considered congested when a SCON message has been received.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT15
structMember.description:
Timer waiting to start signaling route set congestiontest. Used only if the Route Set Congestion Test Selectoption is set to "Use Route Set Congestion test".
Guiding value 20 - 30.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT16
structMember.description:
Timer waiting for route set congestion status update. Used only if the Route Set Congestion Test Selectoption is set to "Use Route Set Congestion test"
Guiding value 14 - 22.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTDlack
structMember.description:
Timer pending an acknowledge from the network layer for a DL_ACK_REQ.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaTassocack
structMember.description: Timer used for SCTP_ASSOCIATE_REQ message acknowledgement. This is the maximum time to wait for the SCTP_COMMUP_IND mesage before considering it to be an error. It should be longer than the time a message spends to reach the most distant destination, be processed and returned.

Timer used for message acknowledgement.

structMember.name: timerM3uaPeriodicAudit
structMember.description:
Timer used for audit procedure.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT1
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing of messages when an association fails.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT3
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing of messages when an association becomes active.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT6
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid mis-sequencing on controlled rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT8
structMember.description:
Delay to prohibit sending of DUNA messages via the response method.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT40
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on controlled/forced rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT41
structMember.description:
Timer controlloing the traffic activation delay during restart phase.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaT42
structMember.description:
The forever interval period for trying association after an unsiccessfull trial.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaTc
structMember.description:
Timer controlling the period a route set is considered congested when a SCON message has been received.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerM3uaTassocack
structMember.description: Timer used for SCTP_ASSOCIATE_REQ message acknowledgement. This is the maximum time to wait for the SCTP_COMMUP_IND mesage before considering it to be an error. It should be longer than the time a message spends to reach the most distant destination, be processed and returned.

struct.name: Mtp3bSpTtcTimerData
struct.description: TTC timers for MTP3bSpTtc. Timervalues in 1/10 s (deciseconds).

structMember.name: timerT1
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on changeover.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT2
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for a COO or a COA.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT3
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on a time controlled diversion change back.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT4
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for CBA, first attempt.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT6
structMember.description:
Timer for delay to avoid message mis-sequencing on controlled rerouting.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT8
structMember.description:
Timer for delay to prohibit sending of TFP messages via the response method. This is a STP specific parameter, which is ignored when configured as an endpoint.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT10
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting to repeat sending of RST periodically.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT17
structMember.description:
Delay to avoid oscillation of initial alignment failure and link restart.
The value for this timer should be less than the value for timerT2.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerSrt
structMember.description:
Timer pending a Signalling Route Test Acknowledgement.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTBsnt
structMember.description:
Waiting for BSNT value from MTP-2 or SAAL (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTRetrieval
structMember.description:
Timer for waiting for completion of buffer retrieval from MTP-2 or SAAL (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTStart
structMember.description:
Timer for retransmission of DL_START_req if no answer received. Started when timerT17 expires. (not standard timer).
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTc
structMember.description:
Controlling the period a route set is considered congested when a Transfer Controlled message has been received.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT15
structMember.description:
Timer waiting to start signaling route set congestiontest. Used only if the Route Set Congestion Test Selectoption is set to "Use Route Set Congestion test".
Guiding value 20 - 30.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerT16
structMember.description:
Timer waiting for route set congestion status update. Used only if the Route Set Congestion Test Selectoption is set to "Use Route Set Congestion test"
Guiding value 14 - 22.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

structMember.name: timerTDlack
structMember.description:
Timer pending an acknowledge from the network layer for a DL_ACK_REQ.
Unit: deciseconds (1/10 second).

struct.name: Mtp3bSpAnsiPriorityData
struct.description: Priority attributes for MTP3b SP of the ANSI standard.

structMember.name: prioSlt
structMember.description: The prioSlt attribute sets the priority for the Signalling Link Test Message and Acknowledge (SLTM / SLTA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioCo
structMember.description: The prioCo attribute sets the priority for the ChangeOver Order and Acknowledge (COO/COA) or eXtended Change over Order and Acknowledge (XCO/XCA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet)

structMember.name: prioCb
structMember.description: The prioCb attribute sets the priority for the Change Back Declaration and Acknowledge (CBD / CBA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioEc
structMember.description: The prioEc attribute sets the priority for the Emergency Change over Order and Acknowledge (ECO / ECA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioRst
structMember.description: The prioRst attribute sets the priority for the signalling Route Set Test (RST) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioTra
structMember.description: The prioTra attribute sets the priority for the Traffic Restart Allowed signal (TRA) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioUpu
structMember.description: The prioUpu attribute sets the priority for the User Part Unavailable (UPU) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioLink
structMember.description:
The prioLink attribute sets the priority for link related messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. The messages are :
Link INhibit (LIN), Link UNinhibit (LUN), Link Inhibit Denied (LID), Link Inhibit Acknowledge (LIA), Link Uninhibit Acknowledge (LUA), Link Forced Uninhibit (LFU), Link Local inhibit Test (LLT) and Link Remote inhibit Test (LRT)
When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

struct.description: Priority attributes for MTP3b SP of the TTC standard.

structMember.name: prioEc
structMember.description: The prioEc attribute sets the priority for the Emergency Change over Order and Acknowledge (ECO / ECA) messages when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioRst
structMember.description: The prioRst attribute sets the priority for the signalling Route Set Test (RST) message when issued by the MTP3b itself. When a message is transferred from the MTP3b the message priority uses the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet).

structMember.name: prioTfa
structMember.description: The prioTfa attribute sets the priority for the Transfer Allowed, TFA, messages.

structMember.name: prioRt

enum.name: Mtp3bNetworkIndTtc
enum.description:
Indicates which type of geographical network, e.g. national, international, etc..
Note: Only for TTC.

enumMember.name: NATIONAL_NETWORK
enumMember.description: National network.

enumMember.name: SPARE
enumMember.description: Spare (for international use only).

enumMember.name: INTERNATIONAL_NETWORK
enumMember.description: International Network.

enumMember.name: SPARE_1
enumMember.description: Spare.

enum.name: Mtp3bUsageState
enum.description:
There are three possible states for the usageState attribute:
- idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic. - active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested. - busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested.

enumMember.name: BUSY
enumMember.description: busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

enum.name: Mtp3bProceduralState
enum.description:
The procedural state of the link.
0 - not initialized 1 - initialized

enumMember.name: NOT_INITIALIZED
enumMember.description: 0 - not initialized.

enumMember.name: INITIALIZED
enumMember.description: 1 - initialized.

enum.name: NodeBehaviourType
enum.description: The nodeBehaviorType attribute represents the MTP3b node type.

enumMember.name: SEP
enumMember.description: Signaling End Point.

enumMember.name: SEP_STP
enumMember.description: Signalling Transfer and End Point, i.e the signalling point is of both type Signalling End Point (SEP) and Signalling Transfer Point (STP).

enumMember.name: SGW_STP_SEP
enumMember.description: Signaling GateWay, Signaling End Point and Signalling Transfer Point, i.e the signalling point is of both type Signalling Transfer Point (STP), Signaling End Point (SEP) and Signaling GateWay (SGW).

exception.name: RouteNotFoundException
exception.description: Invalid IP route has been given as a parameter to an action.

exception.name: InvalidRouteException
exception.description: Invalid IP route has been given as a parameter to an action.

enum.name: ControllerMode
enum.description: The controller mode of a physical interface.

struct.name: OspfAreaRange
struct.description: ipAddress - the subnet address of the range. subnetMask - IP subnet mask of the range to be added. advertise - indicates whether the area range should be advertised into OSPF.

structMember.name: subnetMask
structMember.description:
Note! The subnet has to be contigious. That is, has the LSB set to 0 (zero).
Example:
255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Not-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

structMember.name: destinationIpAddr
structMember.description: The destination IP address.

structMember.name: destinationNetworkMask
structMember.description: The destination IP network mask.

structMember.name: nextHopIpAddr
structMember.description: The next hop IP address.

structMember.name: routeMetric
structMember.description: The route metric.

structMember.name: routeType
structMember.description: The route type.

structMember.name: interfaceName
structMember.description: The interface name.

structMember.name: redistribute
structMember.description: Indicates if the route should be redistributed.

structMember.name: active
structMember.description: Indicates if the route is active.

enum.name: AutoConfigurationMode
enum.description: Denotes whether the autoConfiguration mode for the IpAccessHost is turned on or off.

enum.name: Aal5TpSelectionModes
enum.description:
In case 'NO_PREFERENCE', 'LOCAL_MP_SELECT_VCC_AT_LINK_UP', LOCAL_MP_PEER_SELECTION_VCC' or 'LOCAL_MP_ACTIVE_RESELECTION' is selected the IpAtmLink MO will prefer Aal5TpVccTp on local MP (i.e. Aal5TpVccTp executing on the same MP as the IpAtmLink), but other Aal5TpVccTp will be accepted if needed.
In case 'ONLY_LOCAL_MP' is selected, the ipAtmLink (Inet Link) will consider Aal5TpVccTp residing on other MPs as a malfunction and discard the usage of them. No InvArp sending will be performed on them and all incomming trafic on them will be discarded. If no local Aal5TpVccTp exists the operational state of the link will be changed to disabled.

enumMember.name: LOCAL_MP_SELECT_VCC_AT_LINK_UP
enumMember.description: Prefer termination on local MP, select Vcc when link goes up.

enumMember.name: LOCAL_MP_PEER_SELECTION_VCC
enumMember.description: Prefer termination on local MP, follow peer selection of Vcc.

enumMember.name: LOCAL_MP_ACTIVE_RESELECTION
enumMember.description: Prefer termination on local MP, active reselection to new Aal5TpVccTp as soon as a better choice exists.

enumMember.name: ONLY_LOCAL_MP
enumMember.description: Restricted to local MP, follow peer selection if termination is on local MP.

enum.name: AlarmReport
enum.description: Alarm report for the Virtual path connection termination point. RDI - Remote defect indication LOC - Loss of continuity AIS - Alarm indication signal

enumMember.name: ALARM_LOC
enumMember.description: For alarms of type Loss of continuity.

enumMember.name: ALARM_LOC_RDI
enumMember.description: For alarms of type Loss of continuity and Remote defect indication.

enumMember.name: ALARM_AIS_LOC
enumMember.description: For alarms of type Alarm indication signal and Loss of continuity.

enumMember.name: ALARM_AIS_RDI_LOC
enumMember.description: For alarms of type Alarm indication signal, Remote defect indication and Loss of continuity.

enumMember.name: PM_MODE_OFF
enumMember.description: Performance monitoring is turned off. PM counters give irrelevant values.

enumMember.name: PM_MODE_ONLYCOUNT
enumMember.description: Performance monitoring counters are active

enumMember.name: PM_MODE_FPM
enumMember.description:
FPM, Forward Performance Monitoring activated.
Performance monitoring counters are active

enumMember.name: PM_MODE_BR
enumMember.description:
Backward reporting, BR, cells are generated.
Performance monitoring counters are active

enumMember.name: PM_MODE_FPM_BR
enumMember.description:
FPM, Forward Performance Monitoring activated.
Backward reporting, BR, cells are generated.
Performance monitoring counters are active

enum.name: AtmNomPmBlkSize
enum.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, blocksize. The minimum number of ATM cells to send before sending a Forward Performance Monitoring, FPM, cell.

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_7
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e7 (2 to the power of 7).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_8
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e8 (2 to the power of 8).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_9
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e9 (2 to the power of 9).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_10
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e10 (2 to the power of 10).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_11
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e11 (2 to the power of 11).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_12
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e12 (2 to the power of 12).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_13
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e13 (2 to the power of 13).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_14
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e14 (2 to the power of 14).

enumMember.name: NOM_PM_BLKSIZE_2_15
enumMember.description: Nominal performance monitoring, PM, block size, 2e15 (2 to the power of 15).

enumMember.name: SERVICE_CATEGORY_CBR
enumMember.description: Service category Constant Bit rate, CBR.

enumMember.name: SERVICE_CATEGORY_UBR
enumMember.description: Service category Unspecified Bit rate, UBR.

enumMember.name: SERVICE_CATEGORY_UBR_PLUS
enumMember.description: Service category Unspecified Bit rate+, UBR+. UBR+ guarantees a certain bandwidth. If higher bandwidth is used it will be handled as UBR.

enum.name: AtmQos
enum.description:
ATM's Quality of Service classes.
The ATM layer system provides four QoS classes, numbered 1 to 4, where CLASS_ONE gives the best QoS in regards to Cell Loss Ratio <CLR> and Cell Delay Variation <CDV> and CLASS_FOUR doesn't give any QoS guarantees. CLASS_ONE and CLASS_TWO are the only classes applicable for real time traffic.

enumMember.name: CLASS_ONE
enumMember.description: CDV < 1 ms (milliseconds), CLR < 10e-8. Typically used by timing unit.

enumMember.name: CLASS_TWO
enumMember.description: CDV < 1 ms, CLR < 10e-7. Typically used for speech.

enumMember.name: CLASS_THREE
enumMember.description: CLR < 10e-5. Typically used for signalling.

enumMember.name: CLASS_FOUR
enumMember.description: Typically used for IP.

struct.name: ValueOfUnex
struct.description: The attributes in this struct represents the ATM header, (vpi, vci, pti), of the last recieved unexpected cell.

structMember.name: vpi
structMember.description: The ATM header vpi.

structMember.name: vci
structMember.description: The ATM header vci.

structMember.name: pti
structMember.description: The ATM header pti.

class.name: TransportNetwork
class.description:
This MO structures the transport network of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, TransportNetwork=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

action.name: getAal5ForNniSaal
action.description:
This action returns a sequnce of Aal5TpVccTp MOs that is unreserved and executes on an MP.
Also the following condition has to be fullfilled:
MinAal5Sdu = min (fromUserMaxSduSize, toUserMaxSduSize)
roundedDownSdu = (MinAal5Sdu - (MinAal5Sdu modulo 4) +4)
roundedDownSdu > low boundry for maxSduSize (in NniSaalTp)
Note that the values for fromUserMaxSduSize and toUserMaxSduSize is the actual values set in the Aal5TpVccTp MO. Also note that the attributes minAal5Sdu and roundedDownSdu is used internaly in this action.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getAal5ForUniSaal
action.description:
This action returns a sequnce of Aal5TpVccTp MOs that is unreserved and executes on an MP.
Also the following condition has to be fullfilled:
MinAal5Sdu = min (fromUserMaxSduSize, toUserMaxSduSize)
roundedDownSdu = (MinAal5Sdu - (MinAal5Sdu modulo 4) +4)
roundedDownSdu > low boundry for maxSduSize (in UniSaalTp)
Note that the values for fromUserMaxSduSize and toUserMaxSduSize is the actual values set in the Aal5TpVccTp MO. Also note that the attributes minAal5Sdu and roundedDownSdu is used internaly in this action.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getAal2PathForAal2Pdu
action.description:
This action returns a sequence of all unreserved Aal2PathVccTp's that have an Aal2PathId that has not been used by another Aal2PathDistributionUnit under the same parent (Aal2Ap).
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getRpuForAal2Pdu
action.description:
This action returns a sequence of all ReliableProgramUniters that has not reached the maximun number of possible reservations and has not already been used by other Aal2PathDistributionUnit MO's (if exists) under the same parent (Aal2Ap MO).
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getUnreservedPluginUnits
action.description:
This action returns a sequence of PlugInUnits that is unreserved.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getDs0BundlesForMtp2
action.description:
This action returns a sequence of Ds0Bundle MOs that is unreserved and only has one (1) timeSlot set in the listOfTimeSlots. The attribute tdmMode in these Ds0Bundles must be enabled.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Slot
class.description:
The Slot MO is used to represent a slot in a subrack. A slot can hold a plug-in-unit, a board, (represented by PlugInUnit MOs).
The number of slots in a subrack is specified when defining the subrack.
The system will automatically create the right number of Slot MOs in the subrack at creation of the Subrack MO. This MO cannot be deleted by an operator.
The local distinguished names of this MO's are select with identity Slot=1 in the leftmost slot with incremental numbering towards the right in the subrack..

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A user friendly name associated to the managed object

attribute.name: slotState
attribute.description: Gives the state of the slot.

attribute.name: slotNumber
attribute.description: The number of the position from the left side, starting from 1.

attribute.name: reservedBy
