attribute.description: The time, in seconds, between LSA re-transmissions over the interface - default value 5 seconds.

attribute.name: helloInterval
attribute.description:
The time, in seconds, between sending OSPF Hello-packets over the interface. Default value 10 seconds.
Note! Must be a positive value.

attribute.name: routerDeadInterval
attribute.description: The time, in seconds, after which a neighbor router is declared dead when not heard from.

attribute.name: interfaceTransitDelay
attribute.description: Estimated delay, in seconds, for the transmission of a link state update package over the interface.

attribute.name: interfacePriority
attribute.description:
The interface priority. Each router is configured with a priority configured from 0 - 255 where 0 is the lowest priority and 255 the highest.
Note! Must be a positive value.

attribute.name: relatedLink
attribute.description: Each OSPF interface is connected to one IP link. The relatedLink can be either an IpAtmLink or an EthernetLink MO reference.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfIfEvents
attribute.description:
Performance monitoring counter for the number of times this OSPF interface has changed its state or an error has occured.
See RFC 1850.

class.name: Ospf
class.description:
The Ospf MO represents an instance of the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) routing protocol running in a Cello node.
When the Ospf MO is created a default OspfArea MO is also created. This OspfArea has the areaId 000.000.000.000.
The attribute range0 in the default OspfArea will contain the following values: advertise = false ipAddress = 000.000.000.000 subnetMask = 000.000.000.000

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: ospfRouterId
attribute.description: The ospfRouterId attribute is in the form of an IP address. In order to able to set ospfRouterId the attribute administrativeState has to be set to locked. The ospfRouterId is uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. By convention to ensure uniqueness, this should be configured to the value of one of the routers IP interface addresses.

attribute.name: ospfASBdrRtrStatus
attribute.description: The ospfASBdrRtrStatus attribute controls, whether this router is configured as an Autonomous System border router (Routers connected to multiple areas are called area border routers). The attribute must be set to 'True' if the user wants to configure static routes, which should be distributed to other OSPF routes as external routes. Configuration of static routes is the same as adding and deleting static routes to the IpRoutingTable Mo.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the MO. The operationalState can only be enabled when the IP MO is in workingMode routerMode.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the MO.

attribute.name: ospfAreaBdrRtrStatus
attribute.description: Area border router flag - indicates whether the router is acting as an area border router or not.

attribute.name: ipMo
attribute.description: The name of the Ip MO that the Ospf MO is to use

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled. It is a bit mapped CORBA long, where one or more of the bits may be set. If none of the bits are set then the availability status is considered to be undefined.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfOriginateNewLsas
attribute.description:
The number of new link-state advertisments that have been originated. This number is incremented each time the router originates a new LSA.
For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfRxNewLsas
attribute.description:
The number of link-state advertisments received determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self-originated link-state advertisments.
For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.

attribute.name: recoverTopoDb
attribute.description: Indicates whether the topology database is to be recovered from the database at restart.

attribute.name: topoDbStoreInterv
attribute.description: The interval, in seconds, with which the topology database will be stored.

class.name: OspfArea
class.description:
An OSPF autonomous system is divided into OSPF areas. The OSPF Area MO represents such OSPF areas.
A default OspfArea MO is automatically created when the Ospf MO is created. It has the identity = 1, so LDN of this MO will be ManagedElement=1,IpSystem=1,Ospf=1,OspfArea=1.
Note! A maximum of 4 OspfAreas can be configured each with a maximum of 8 interfaces.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: stubArea
attribute.description: Indicates whether the OSPF area is a stub area or not.

attribute.name: importExternalLsa
attribute.description: Indicates whether importing Autonomous System external LSA's is supported.

attribute.name: sendAreaSummary
attribute.description: Import Area summary - indicates whether the router will originate and propagate summary LSAs into a stub-area.

attribute.name: stubAreaMetric
attribute.description: Cost for default route that the router advertises into the area if the area is a stub area and the router is an area border router. By default set to the least metric among the interfaces to other areas.

attribute.name: stubAreaMetricType
attribute.description:
Stub Area metric type.
RFC 1850 (OSPF V2 MIB):
comparableCost (external type 1) nonComparable (external type 2)

attribute.name: areaLsaChecksum
attribute.description: Area Lsa checksum - 32-bit unsigned sum of the link-state advertisements LS check sums contained in this area's link-state database.

attribute.name: areaId
attribute.description: The OSPF area identity in form of an IP address. This areId uniquely identifies the area. AreaId 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone. Range: 000.000.000.000 to 255.255.255.255.

attribute.name: range0
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range zero (0).

attribute.name: range1
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range one (1).

attribute.name: range2
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range two (2).

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfSpfRuns
attribute.description:
The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using this area's link-state database. This is typically done using Dijkstra's algorithm.
For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the reserving OspfInterface MOs.

action.name: addAreaRange
action.description:
Add aggregation range. Used to add a range of IP addresses to an OSPF area.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteAreaRange
action.description:
Delete an IP address range. Used to remove a range of IP addresses from an OSPF area.
Input is the area aggregation range index.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: SwitchCoreUnit
class.description: The Switch Core Unit MO, SCU, represents the board specific HW on the SCB. This object collects HW failure on the board and sends alarms. It is also used for configuration of board specific FW. This board can only be fitted in slot 1 and 28 in a standards subrack. The board has a number of switch internal link ports.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: user label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSili
attribute.description: The administrative state of the switch internal link ports on the switch board. The attribute refers to all ports (locking will lock all ports, unlocking unlock all ports). SILI -switch internal link interface.

attribute.name: operationalStateSil
attribute.description: Operational state indicates the the traffic handling capability of all ports as a group on the board, i.e it is enabled if one or more of the eight ports is enabled. The purpose of this attribute is only for test.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description: Operational State for network synchronization distribution.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSil
attribute.description:
The availability status of the switch internal link (SIL) ports..
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
Availability state for network synchronization distribution.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: A list of the reserving MO's.

attribute.name: silPorts
attribute.description: The attribute provides a list of port numbers. The port number is between 0-7 and is used to read state of the switch internal port. See action getSilPortState, getOperState and getAvailState.

action.name: getSilPortState
action.description:
Returns status of the switch internal link port, which is the same as the LEDs on the unit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getSilOperState
action.description:
Returns operational status of the switch internal link port.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getSilAvailState
action.description:
Returns availability status of the switch internal link port.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: GeneralProcessorUnit
class.description:
The General purpose Processor Unit MO, GPU, represents the board specific HW on the GPB; hard disk, ethernet and serial port etc.
Note! The 'availabilityStatus' for the GeneralProcessorUnit MO is retreived from the PlugInUnit MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
Indicates if the function provided by the managed object is capable of performing its normal functions or not.
Note! The value for operationalState is retrived from the GeneralProcessorUnit's parent, i.e. the PlugInUnit.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDSize
attribute.description: The total size in bytes of the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDFreespace
attribute.description: The amount in bytes of freespace available on the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePSize
attribute.description: The total size in bytes of the P volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePFreespace
attribute.description: The amount in bytes of freespace available on the P volume.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds the identity of the reserving MO.

class.name: Jvm
class.description:
The JVM MO is used to represent the Java Virtual Machine. This object is used for configuration JVM parameters, including SW management of Java class libraries used in the machine.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, Equipment=1, JVM=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Current classpath, the JVM is using

attribute.name: admClasspath
attribute.description: New classpath that will be activated at next restart of JVM. The classpath has a directory, which contains the load module, i.e. the classpath references the load module.

attribute.name: freeMemory
attribute.description:
Free memory in the java machine, in bytes.
NOTE: Before this value is read from the system the action 'garbageCollect' is invoked.

attribute.name: totalMemory
attribute.description: Total amount of memory allocated to the java machine, in bytes.

attribute.name: mopplets
attribute.description:
Contains all classes that are to be initilised and started when the JVM restarts.
Technical note: The specified classes must implement the se.ericsson.cello.moframework.Mopplet interface and be found in a jar/zip-file pointed out by the classpath.

attribute.name: main
attribute.description: Defines the start class name. e.g. "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms"

attribute.name: options
attribute.description: Current options: -D<property>=<value> Set a system property value. Commonly java.class.path -Xms<size> Specify the size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. -Xss<size> Set thread stack size in bytes. -Xverify:[all | remote | none] Verify classes according to the suboption. -Xverify:all verifies all classes. -Xverify:remote verifies remote classes only. -Xverify:none turns off class verification.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: Determines the current system properties.

attribute.name: reliableProgramUniter
attribute.description: A reference to the ReliableProgramUniter that refers to the programs in the which the JVM executes.

attribute.name: admMain
attribute.description: New start class that will be activated at next restart of the JVM. e.g. "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms"

attribute.name: admOptions
attribute.description:
This attribute is used when setting one or more administrative options.
A set option is operational after the next Java Machine restart.
See also attribute 'options'
One or more options can be set, one option in each string of the sequence according to description below:
Current options: -D<property>=<value> Set a system property value. Commonly java.class.path -Xms<size> Specify the size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. -Xss<size> Set thread stack size in bytes. -Xverify:[all | remote | none] Verify classes according to the suboption. -Xverify:all verifies all classes. -Xverify:remote verifies remote classes only. -Xverify:none turns off class verification.

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description: This attribute holds the identity of the reserving MO.

action.name: garbageCollect
action.description:
Runs the garbage collector.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

action.name: setProperty
action.description:
Sets a system property (i.e. propertys in the operating system). Note! The valeus set with this action is not saved in the database.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

action.name: restart
action.description:
Restart of executing JVM instance.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

class.name: SwitchFabric
class.description:
This MO represents the switch of a Cello node. It is used for general switch configuration.
The system creates automatically one instance of this MO at restart.
Today, only a maximum of 32 Switch Modules MOs and 2 SwitchInternalLinks MOs per InternalLinkGroup MOs are allowed in a Cello node. However, in theory the switch addressing space in the system allows up to 256 SwitchModules MOs. This would then mean there are 255 InternalLinkGroup MOs, each of which is allowed 256 SwitchInternalLink MOs by the addressing.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, SwitchFabric=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: For free use.

class.name: SwitchModule
class.description:
This MO represents two switch planes of one sub-rack, i.e. either the main switch or an external switch.
Note! In a non-redundant system the administrativeStateSwitchPlaneA/B has to be set to locked for the non-present plane.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: For free use.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber
attribute.description:
Indicates the number of the switch module, SMN.
switchModuleNumber >= 0
The main switch module, with one or two TimingUnits, is given SMN = 0. SMN for extension switch modules depends on the port pair that the extension switch module is connected to in the main switch module.
The SMN is calculated according to the following formula:
Switch module number [1..255] = int (APN/2)*8 + ISL-port in main [1..8]
APN - ASCC port number ISL - inter-switch link

attribute.name: secondSmnEvaluation
attribute.description: secondSmnEvaluation - There are two cables that are relevant for Switch Module Number (smn) numbering If the cabling is wrong secondSmnEvaluation will show the second opinion about smn. Under normal conditions secondSmnEvaluation = smn.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state of the switch module.
Note! When setting the 'administrativeState' to shutting down a notification about that the state has changed to 'locked' will be sent towards the operator. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been succesful despite the notification and state change due to limitations in the resource layer

attribute.name: administrativeStateSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description:
The administrative state of switch plane A. It is not allowed to lock both switch plane A and B.
Note! When setting the 'administrativeState' to shutting down a notification about that the state has changed to 'locked' will be sent towards the operator. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been succesful despite the notification and state change due to limitations in the resource layer

attribute.name: administrativeStateSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description:
The administrative state of switch plane B. It is not allowed to lock both switch plane A and B.
Note! When setting the 'administrativeState' to shutting down a notification about that the state has changed to 'locked' will be sent towards the operator. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been succesful despite the notification and state change due to limitations in the resource layer

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Switch Module. At least one of switch plane is enabled.

attribute.name: operationalStateSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description: The operational state of Switch Module plane A. The state is disabled if any switch ports is faulty. But switch may still be used.

attribute.name: operationalStateSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description: The operational state of Switch Module plane B. The state is disabled if any switch ports is faulty. But switch may still be used.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Module.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Plane A.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Plane B.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: activeSwitchPlane
attribute.description: The active switch plane: A, B. During multiple faults, both plan A and B may be used.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving MOs.

class.name: InternalLinkGroup
class.description:
The Internal Link Group MO represents all switch internal links connecting the main switch to an external switch.
Switch internal links are automatically grouped in Reliable Groups for redundancy.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: For free use.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber1
attribute.description: Reference to the SwitchModule MO that is interconnected by the link in the InternalLinkGroup.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber2
attribute.description: Reference to the SwitchModule MO that is interconnected by the link in the InternalLinkGroup.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative status of internal link group.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational status of internal link group.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

action.name: getRlgLinks
action.description:
Returns a list of resource instance identities of the switch internal links in the specified Reliable Group.
The existing Reliable Groups are listed with action getReliableLinkGroups.
Note! This action is transactional.

action.name: getLinkStatus
action.description:
Returns the status of the specified switch internal link, within the specified Reliable Group.
Note! This action is transactional.

action.name: getReliableLinkGroups
action.description:
Returns a sequence of Reliable Group numbers.
Each Reliable Group is identified by a unique number which can be used to read out the identities of the switch internal links that are allocated to the Reliable Group. This is done with action getRlgLinks.
The allocation of switch internal links to Reliable Groups is automatic.
Note! This action is transactional.

class.name: SwitchInternalLink
class.description:
This MO represents a link interconnecting the from either a SCB or SXB port on the main switch to a SCB on an external switch.
The main switch is located in the hub subrack.
The SCB is represented by the SwitchCoreUnit MO, while the SXB is represented by the SwitchExtensionUnit MO.
Switch internal links are automatically grouped in Reliable Groups for redundancy.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: plugInUnit1
attribute.description: The reference of one connection point for a SwitchCoreUnit or SwitchExtensionUnit.

attribute.name: plugInUnit2
attribute.description: The reference of one connection point for a SwitchCoreUnit or SwitchExtensionUnit.

attribute.name: siliport1
attribute.description:
Switch internal port number on PlugInUnit1.
Note! On a standard SCB/SXB board, the ports are labeled from the bottom to the top.
Port nr -> label: '0' 'D' '1' 'C' '2' 'B' '3' 'A'
Also note that his mapping will change when adding/removing a board.

attribute.name: siliport2
attribute.description:
Switch internal port number on PlugInUnit2.
Note! On a standard SCB/SXB board, the ports are labeled from the bottom to the top.
Port nr -> label: '0' 'D' '1' 'C' '2' 'B' '3' 'A'
Also note that his mapping will change when adding/removing a board.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of switch internal link.

attribute.name: operationalStateTraffic
attribute.description: The operational state of switch internal link. There is no traffic if the link is disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusTraffic
attribute.description:
The availabilityl status of switch internal link.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description: The operational state of sync link. There is no clock distribution if the link is disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
The availability state of sync link.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: Etm4
class.description:
This MO represents the hardware of the ET-M4 board type. It only represents the ET specific hardware, while the DBM module of the board is represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The ET-M4 board contains 2 physical ports that can be configured as either STM1(ETSI/TTC) or OC3C (ANSI). The board supports unchannelised ATM access (i.e. it maps ATMs cells directly into an SDH VC4 container).
The board supports up to 1800 ATM VC connections. The number of terminated VPs are limited to 48/board. The board supports up to 750 VC UBR+ connections.
The ET-M4 board contains 128 AAL2 multiplexers. The ET-M4 board supports up to 256 bidirectional F4/F5 PM flow per port.
Note! IMA is not applicable for the ETM4 board.
Note! The number of VCC TP+VPC TP with performance monitoring enabled (i.e. PM mode <> off) is restricted to 256 per board.
Note! When using the Etm4 board the performance monitoring counters in the transmit direction found on the AtmPort MO does not show the following cells: CC cells and OAM FPM cells.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the hardware ETM4.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: VpcTp
class.description:
Virtual path connection termination point, VpcTp, is used to represent the point where the VPC and associated overhead (F4 OAM cells) are terminated/originated.
Note! The performance monitoring counters in this MO is set to 0 when counterMode is set to PM_MODE_ON. In PM_MODE_OFF no information at all is retrived. So any value for pm-monitoring is measured from the time of setting counterMode to PM_MODE_ON. At node restart these performance monitoring counters is reset to 0.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the VpcTp

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: continuityCheck
attribute.description: Continuity checking means that a cell is sent downstream when no user cell has been sent for a period of nominally 1 second. Continuity check both enables generation of CC cells as well as detection of LOC

attribute.name: counterMode
attribute.description: PM mode is set to indicate type of performance monitoring mode (i.e. activation of bidirectional PM measurements).

attribute.name: nomPmBlkSize
attribute.description: Nominal performance monitoring (PM) blocksize. The minimum number of ATM cells to send before sending a Forward Performance Monitoring, FPM, cell.

attribute.name: pmFwLostCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost forward cells.

attribute.name: pmFwMissinsCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of forward missinserted cells.

attribute.name: pmFwErrBlocks
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of forward errored blocks.

attribute.name: pmLostFpmCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost Forward Performance Monitoring, FPM, cells.

attribute.name: pmBwLostCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost backward cells.

attribute.name: pmBwMissinsCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of backward missinserted cells.

attribute.name: pmBwErrBlocks
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of backward errored blocks.

attribute.name: pmLostBrCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost Backward Reporting, BR, cells.

attribute.name: alarmReport
attribute.description: Attribute to decide what type of alarms to be reported.

action.name: eteLoopBack
action.description:
This action performs VC end to end loopback from this VpcTp. false=Failed, true=Succeded
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: VplTp
class.description:
This MO is used to represent the termination of a VP link.
Note that a maximum of 999 MO's of this type may be configured.
Note! For information on how many VplTp's that can be configured under the AtmPort MO please refer to the board that is parent to the termination reserved by the AtmPort MO.
The performance monitoring counters in the VplTp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large to fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: This MOs user label.

attribute.name: atmTrafficDescriptor
attribute.description: Reference to the Atm Traffic Descriptor.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the VplTp.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: externalVpi
attribute.description: This is the virtual path identifier for the external ATM cells.

attribute.name: pmReceivedAtmCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of received ATM cells for the VplTp.

attribute.name: pmTransmittedAtmCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of transmitted ATM cells.

class.name: TimingUnit
class.description:
This MO represents a timing unit (reference clock) in the node.
The corresponding Program shall be of LoadModuleLoaderType, SpmFpgaLoader.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Operational state of TimingUnit

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the TimingUnit.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: PiuType
class.description:
The PiuType is an MO that holds product information about a PlugInUnit and the execution resources of the PlugInUnit. It is created/deleted during a software upgrade. The PiuType is used when creating execution MOs connected to a PlugInUnit and when allocating software to this resource.
MOs of this type are created automatically during system upgrade. MOs of this type are possible to create manually but a system upgrade is recommended to create them.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A user friendly name associated to the managed object.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
The productData describes the product number, short product revision, product name and product information of the PlugInUnit. The production date is not used.
Trailing letters in the revision is recommended to be excluded in the PiuType. Example: R2B will be R2 without trailing letter, R2B/3 must be R2B/3 in the PiuType, R2B/A should be R2 in the PiuType.

attribute.name: boardWidth
attribute.description:
The width of the PlugInUnit board in steps of 5 mm. A PlugInUnit can use/cover more than the slot that it occupies.
Example: boardWidth=3 corresponds to 3*5 = 15 mm.

attribute.name: airFlowData
attribute.description: Control value m3/h for the fan unit. Needed by cooling function.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description: The value will be MP if a board has the role of a Main processor. The value will be BP if a board has the role of a device board Otherwise the value will be OTHERS.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity's of the reserving MO's.

action.name: numberOfMoConfigurations
action.description:
Returns the number of entries in the PIUTypeConfigurationArray.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getMoConfiguration
action.description:
Returns a struct of a specific MoConfiguration at a given index. The moConfiguration holds information about how to create the subordinate objects for a specific piu type.
Precondition: 0 <= index <= numberOfMoConfigurations() - 1
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: SwAllocation
class.description:
This MO is primarily used to handle data for automatic configuration of load modules. Automatic in the meaning that the system selects the appropriate load module and revision. A SWA may be related to a slot, indicating that a specific functionality is requested at this location. The SWA is manually created by the operator.
The SWA object is related to (one or more) repertoires, which hold information on possible PIU-type/revisions and load module combinations.
In some cases (e.g multi-purpose boards, boards with processor/FPGA-pools) it may not be possible to completely configure the PIU without instructions from the operator (e.g which load module runs on which processor/FPGA). In these cases a specialization of the SWA has to be designed in such a way that it can be manually configured.
When a SwAllocation MO depends on a ManagedObject MO, this ManagedObject actually represents a RBS Fan.
MOs of this type are created automatically during system upgrade. MOs of this type are possible to create manually but a system upgrade is recommended to create them.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free for use.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description:
The role of a slot/PIU. The role must be unique with respect to other SwAllocations in the node.
This is a preparation to introduce predefined SwAllocation in future upgrade packages.

attribute.name: repertoireList
attribute.description: A list of references to repertoires.

attribute.name: slotList
attribute.description: A list of references to mainly slots in a subrack, e.g. Slot or Fan MO. It may also refer to other objects handling auxiliary units, e.g. RBS Fan.

action.name: addRepertoire
action.description:
Adds the specifed repertoire to this list.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

action.name: deleteRepertoire
action.description:
Removes the first occurrence of the specified repertoire from this list.
Notw! This action does not require a transaction.

action.name: addSlot
action.description:
Adds the specified Slot to the slotList. The slot can only be of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO, JVM MO or an applicable type of application MO (e.g. for "RBS Fans").
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteSlot
action.description:
Removes the first occurrence of the specified slot from this list. The slot can only be of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO or an applicable type of application MO (e.g. for "RBS Fans").
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteAllRepertoires
action.description:
Removes all repertoires from this list and sets its size to zero.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteAllSlots
action.description:
Removes all slots from this list and sets its size to zero.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: addSlots
action.description:
Adds the specified Slot to the slotList. The slot can only be of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO, JVM MO or an applicable type of application MO (e.g. for "RBS Fans"). If the slot exists in the list, the object is ignored.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: addRepertoires
action.description:
Adds the specifed repertoire to this list.
If the repertoires exist in the list the repertoire is ignored.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: MediumAccessUnit
class.description:
The Medium Access Unit (MAU) MO represents the Ethernet transceiver function on a General Processor Board (GPB).
Note! Ethernet links which are modelled by a MediumAccessUnit MO are used for O&M IP traffic only. MediumAccessUnit MOs must not be configured under a GeneralProcessorUnit MO which have a IpAccessHostGpb referring to it.
Note! This object is known in standards as "MediumAttachmentUnit".

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Description of operational state which has an enumerated datatype

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: connectorLabel
attribute.description: This attribute is used by a management system to show the label on the port the connector is attached to.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsLateCollisions
attribute.description: Performance management counter for the number of times that a collision was detected on the interface after the minimum length of a frame.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsFCSErrors
attribute.description: Performance management counter for the number of frames that did not pass the FCS check.

attribute.name: linkSpeed
attribute.description: The Link Speed, measurment unit is Mb/s..

attribute.name: duplexMode
attribute.description: The duplex mode used.

class.name: ReliableProgramUniter
class.description:
A Reliable Program Uniter (RPU) is a controlling and addressing entity providing one common addressing unit for two Reliable Programs. Or more correctly for parts of two Reliable Programs, each part is called a Resource Suite Handler (RSH). The RSH is implemented and owned by the application. It is not a function or a concept within Cello.
MOs of this type are created automatically during system upgrade. MOs of this type are possible to create manually but a system upgrade is recommended to create them.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: For free use.

attribute.name: reliableProgramLabel
attribute.description: Reliable Program Label. Compare this to the reliableProgramLabel in LoadModule MO.

attribute.name: admActiveSlot
attribute.description: Reference to slot, contains the running "Normal" relation to a slot. If the reference is set to the passive slot, the passive slot will be cleared and only one relation will be set.

attribute.name: admPassiveSlot
attribute.description: Reference to slot, contains the running "Stand-by" relation to a slot. If the reference is set to the active slot or a null value, the passive slot will be cleared.

attribute.name: switchOver
attribute.description: This attribute controls when to switchover the RPU, if a certain type error situation occurs.

attribute.name: normalisation
attribute.description: This attribute controls when to switch back the RPU, after error recovery has been done.

attribute.name: replication
attribute.description: This attribute indicates that which level of data replication that is associated with the RPU.

attribute.name: operationalMode
attribute.description: This attribute indicates if the RSH execution mode (active/passive) in the two Reliable Program, matches the normal/stand-by relations set on the corresponding RPU.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving MOs.

action.name: switch
action.description:
This action will force the two corresponding RSHs to change their execution mode (active/passive). It will lead either to a switchover or to a switchback, depending of what value the operational Mode attribute is showing.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: ManagedElementData
class.description:
This object contains attributes and actions on Cello node-level.
The ManagedElementData MO is automatically created and cannot be deleted.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, ManagedElementData=1.

attribute.name: autoConfigurationAllowed
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies if the system is allowed to auto create detected objects. Note that slots will always be auto created.
Note! When setting this attribute from true to false the system creates a new CV.

attribute.name: documentServerAddress
attribute.description: The base URL for the documentation server (ALEX). The attribute is read by Element Management application to find the documentation server in the network.

attribute.name: logonServerAddress
attribute.description: A list of node names or IP addresses of the single logon servers (SLSs). The list uses commas to seperate the single logon server addresses, e.g. "https://SLS1,https://SLS2,https://SLS3", these addresses consists of the URLs to the concerned SLS servers. The attribute is read by Element Management application to find the single logon server in the network.

attribute.name: dhcpServerAddresses
attribute.description:
IP addresses to the DHCP server, used by the DHCP Relay Agent.
Default is an empty array.
Adding and removing addresses is done through the actions addDhcpServerAddress() and removeDhcpServerAddress().

attribute.name: performanceDataPath
attribute.description:
This attribute is used by the internal performance management service to know where to store it's data files. The attribute is the name of a path in the node.
Example: /c/public_html/cello/XML_files/

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressPrimary
attribute.description: This is the IP address to the NTP server

attribute.name: ntpServiceActivePrimary
attribute.description: This is a boolean that controls if the node should poll the primary NTP server for information.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
Note! This value has to be > 0.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
Note! This value has to be > 0.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagPrimary
attribute.description: This is the burst flag used towards the primary NTP server.

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressSecondary
attribute.description: This is an alternative IP address to a NTP server

attribute.name: ntpServiceActiveSecondary
attribute.description: This is a boolean that controls if the node should poll the secondary NTP server for information.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
Note! This value has to be > 0.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
Note! This value has to be > 0.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagSecondary
attribute.description: This is the burst flag used towards the secondary NTP server.

attribute.name: nodeUTCTime
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the UTC time used in the node. The attribute value is milliseconds since epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT). The value may only be set while ntpServiceActive both for primary and secondary is false.

attribute.name: nodeLocalTimeZone
attribute.description:
This value states in what time zone the node is located. This attribute is needed by management application to convert UTC time from a log or NTP service to local time. It will not change the real time clock on the node.
The timeZone is represented by three characters, example GMT.
Available options are:
TimeZone ID Offset GMT (Greenwich Mean Time) 0 UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) 0 ECT ( Central European Standard Time) + 1 EET (Eastern European Time) + 2 ART (Eastern European Time) + 2 EAT (Eastern African Time) + 3 MET (Iran Time) + 3.5 NET (Armenia Time) + 4 PLT (Pakistan Time) + 5 IST (India Standard Time) + 5.5 BST (Bangladesh Time) + 6 VST (Indochina Time) + 7 CTT (China Standard Time) + 8 JST (Japan Standard Time) + 9 CST (Central Standard Time) + 9.5 EST (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 AET (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 SST (Solomon Is. Time) + 11 NST (New Zealand Standard Time) + 12 CAT (Central Alaska Time) - 1 AGT (Argentina Time) - 3 BET (Brazil Time) - 3 CNT (Newfoundland Standard Time) - 3.5 PRT (Atlantic Standard Time) - 4 IET (Eastern Standard Time) - 5 ACT (Central Standard Time) - 6 PNT (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 MST (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 PST (Pacific Standard Time) - 8 AST (Alaska Standard Time) - 9 HST (Hawaii Standard Time) - 10 MIT (West Saoma Time) - 11 --
Reference: http://www.greenwichmeantime.com

attribute.name: daylightSavingTime
attribute.description: This attribute states weather daylight saving time is used on this node. It is used to by the management application and will not change the real time clock on the node.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCSize
attribute.description: The total size of the C volume on the Cello node in bytes. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCFreespace
attribute.description: The number of bytes of free space available on the C volume. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks in a Cello node.

attribute.name: nodeUniqueID
attribute.description: This is a unique node identity to be set only in the factory.

attribute.name: swServerUrlList
attribute.description:
A list of URLs of external server for downloading of software. A comma-separated list or URLs, complete with path and name of property file.
Note: For downloading of software for system upgrade, see attribute ftpServerIpAddress in MO UpdradePackage.

attribute.name: piuGroupEscalationType
attribute.description: The type of node restart when it is a problem with the last PIU in a PIU group.

attribute.name: syncModeOperation
attribute.description: The sync mode operation of the node. Note that this attribute is only relevant when the node contains CBU board. For all other cases the value shall be set to NOT_USED.

action.name: createNtpPrimary
action.description:
This action creates the primary Network Time Protocol. There can only exist one primary and one secondary ntp.
Once the ntp is created it is possible to change the attributes, i.e ip address, burst flag, max- and min poll and which is the active one.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: createNtpSecondary
action.description:
This action creates the secondary/alterative Network Time Protocol. There can only exist one primary and one secondary ntp.
Once the ntp is created it is possible to change the attributes, i.e ip address, burst flag, max- and min poll and which is the active one.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteNtpPrimary
action.description:
This action deletes the primary NTP.
An exception will be thrown if the primary attributes are accessed (set and get).
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deleteNtpSecondary
action.description:
This action deletes the secondary NTP.
An exception will be thrown if the secondary attributes are accessed (set and get).
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: addDhcpServerAddress
action.description:
Takes an array of Ip addresses (Strings), and adds them to the list held by the Dhcp Relay Agent fRO.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot. E.g. 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

action.name: removeDhcpServerAddress
action.description:
Takes an array of Ip addresses (Strings), and removes them from the list held by the Dhcp Relay Agent fRO.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot. E.g. 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

action.name: setNodeUniqueId
action.description:
Used for setting the nodeUniqueId attribute. This method should only be used in the factory, i.e. it is not for general use by the operator.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: SwitchExtensionUnit
class.description: This MO represents the Switch Extension Unit, SXU, board. The board may only be inserted in slot 2-27 (in a standard subrack). If redundant links are used, two boards must be inserted next to each other. The board has a number of switch internal link ports.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: This attribute is used to hold a user friendly name of the object if needed.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSil
attribute.description: The administrative state of switch internal link ports on the switch board. The attribute refers to all ports (locking will lock all ports, unlocking will unlock all ports). SIL- switch internal link.

attribute.name: operationalStateSil
attribute.description: Operational State for all ports. Operational state is enabled if one of the eight ports is enabled.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description: Operational State for network synchronization distribution

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSil
attribute.description:
The availability state of switch internal link (sil) ports.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
The availability state of the sync link.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The attribute is set by the action Reserve.

attribute.name: SilPorts
attribute.description: The attribute provides a list of port numbers. The port number is between 0-7 and is used to read state of the switch internal port. Se action getSilPortState, getSilOperState and getSilAvailState.

action.name: getSilPortState
action.description:
Returns status of the switch internal link port.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getSilOperState
action.description:
Returns operational status of the switch internal link port.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: getSilAvailState
action.description:
Returns availability status of the switch internal link port.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Aal2PathDistributionUnit
class.description: This MO is used to represent an AAL2 Path Distribution Unit. Such a unit handles a set of Aal2PathVccTps that belong to the same Aal2 AP and that are handled by the same Path Resource Handling Program. This Path Resource Handling Program is referenced by the rpuId attribute.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: rpuId
attribute.description:
The physical location of a CPS RC (Common Part Sub-Layer Resource Control) program represented by a reference to a ReliableProgramUniter.
Note that one ReliableProgramUniter MO may only be referenced once under one Aal2Ap. That means all Aal2PathDistributionUnits must reference different ReliableProgramUniter MO's.
Two Aal2PathDistributionUnits under different Aal2Ap's may however reference the same ReliableProgramUniter MO.

attribute.name: aal2PathVccTpList
attribute.description: List of references to Aal2PathVccTp MO:s. Note that setting of this attribute removes the current list of Aal2PathVccTp's. Each reference must be unique among all paths within all Aal2PathDistributionUnit's belonging to the same Aal2Ap.

action.name: addPath
action.description:
This action adds a list of Aal2PathVccTps to an Aal2PathDistributionUnit.
If the data contains a reference to a non existing path, the exception InvalidReference is raised.
If the path list contains a path that has a non-unique aal2PathId value, then the exception Aal2PathIdNotUnique is raised. The pathId value must be unique within all Aal2PathDistributionUnits under the same Aal2Ap.
If the path list contains a path that already belongs to a Aal2PathDistributionUnit, then the exception PathAlreadyRegistered is raised.
Note! Adding one or more Aal2PathVccTps using this action updates the attribute 'Aal2PathVccTpList'.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: removePath
action.description:
This action removes a list (sequence) of AAL2 path's from the Aal2PathDistributionUnit.
If the path list contains a path that is not in this Aal2PathDistributionUnit, the exception NotInGroup is raised.
Note! Removing one or more Aal2PathVccTps using this action updates the attribute 'Aal2PathVccTpList'.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Fan
class.description:
The Fan is used for cooling the Cello-subrack and is connected to one or two SCU (switch core board). This MO is used for controlling and sending alarm from the Fan.
Note, either the fan can be supplied by Cello and Fan MO is used, or alternatively the fan can supplied by a source external to Cello and therefore a ManagedObject MO is used to represent the fan.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: user label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrativeState of Fan MO.

attribute.name: connectedToScu
attribute.description:
A Fan must always be connected to a Switch Core unit that mediates the communication with a main processor.
In this attribute it is possible to see which SwichCoreUnit that the fan is connected to.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state is set to 'enabled' when the Fan has loaded and started its load module.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: A reference to an available PiuType at create of a Fan.

attribute.name: controllingState
attribute.description:
The application that controls the Fan has three main states: - standalone: running on itself, not manageable - autonomous: manageable state - noiseReduced: temporary state with reduced cooling
NOTE: This attribute is not supported in CPP 4.

attribute.name: hdlcAddress
attribute.description: The physical address of the RS-485 communication link. Incorrect setting of the address can cause collision with other connected auxiliary units or lost connection. The default value should be suitable for most configurations.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO.

action.name: restartFan
action.description:
A restart will cause the Fan to be initiated, re-booted and all load modules to be reloaded from persistent memory. This is also known as a forced reload.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Mtp2TpItu
class.description:
This MO represents a MTP2 Termination Point for the ITU standard, as defined in Recommendation Q.703 07/96.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp2Itu MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is a hardware fault, aal1 server/adm restart or node restart.
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ITU standard.
NOTE: There is a restriction of a maximum of 32 Mtp2Tp's per MP.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free tag for marking this managed object.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the MTP2 Signalling Terminal.

attribute.name: mtp2ProfileItuId
attribute.description:
Reference to a Mtp2ProfileItu MO.
Note: The bitRate can not be changed.

attribute.name: pmNoOfReTransmittedOctets
attribute.description: Number of re-transmitted octets.

attribute.name: pmNoOfNacks
attribute.description: Number of negative acknowledgements received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuReceivedInError
attribute.description: Number of signal units received in error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfStartedRBCongestion
attribute.description: Number of started local RB congestions.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSendBufferOctets
attribute.description: Number of octets in send buffer.

attribute.name: pmLocalSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in local SIB (Sending).

attribute.name: pmRemoteSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in remote SIB (Receiving).

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of SIO & SIF octets transmitted.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The attribute is set by the list of reserving MO's.

attribute.name: ds0BundleId
attribute.description: The Ds0Bundle MO that this MO references.

attribute.name: plugInUnitId
attribute.description:
The PlugInUnit MO that this MO references. It indicates on which processor the Termination Point will be.
Note: The PlugInUnit must be of type GPB.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of MSUs transmitted.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFReceived
attribute.description: Number of SIO and SIF octets received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUReceived
attribute.description: Number of MSUs received..

class.name: Mtp2TpAnsi
class.description:
This MO represents a MTP2 Termination Point for the ANSI standard , as defined in T1.111-1996.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp2Ansi MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is a hardware fault, aal1 server/adm restart or node restart.
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contained by or dependent on) an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ANSI standard.
NOTE: There is a restriction of a maximum of 32 Mtp2Tp's per MP.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free tag for marking this managed object.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the MTP2 Signalling Terminal.

attribute.name: mtp2ProfileAnsiId
attribute.description:
Reference to a Mtp2ProfileAnsi MO.
Note: The bitRate can not be changed.

attribute.name: pmNoOfReTransmittedOctets
attribute.description: Number of re-transmitted octets.

attribute.name: pmNoOfNacks
attribute.description: Number of negative acknowledgements received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuReceivedInError
attribute.description: Number of signal units received in error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfStartedRBCongestion
attribute.description: Number of started local RB congestions.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSendBufferOctets
attribute.description: Number of octets in send buffer.

attribute.name: pmLocalSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in local SIB (Sending).

attribute.name: pmRemoteSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in remote SIB (Receiving).

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of SIO & SIF octets transmitted.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUReceived
attribute.description: Number of MSUs received..

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving MO.

attribute.name: ds0BundleId
attribute.description: The Ds0Bundle MO that this MO references.

attribute.name: plugInUnitId
attribute.description:
The PlugInUnit MO that this MO references. It indicates on which processor the Termination Point will be.
Note: The PlugInUnit must be of type GPB.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of MSUs transmitted.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFReceived
attribute.description: Number of SIO and SIF octets received.

class.name: Ds0Bundle
class.description:
The Ds0Bundle, Digital Signalling Level 0, MO represents a number of timeslots on a physical port. Any of E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, E1Ttp or T1Ttp. The Ds0Bundle can be used in three different ways:
- Fractional ATM
Please refer to the AtmPort MO for details. Note that the TdmMode attribute must be disabled.
-Circuit emulation
Please refer to Aal1VccTp MO for details. Note that the TdmMode attribute must be disabled. Note that only 4 Ds0Bundle's per port can be configured when running circuit emulation.
- TDM Switching
The Ds0Bundle is reserved for switching node internal Ds0 connections. In this mode, the tdmMode attribute should be enabled.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free tag for marking this managed object.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availabiltity status of Ds0Bundle.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of Ds0Bundle.

attribute.name: listOfTimeSlots
attribute.description:
The list gives the time slots (within ATM traffic fraction) that are to be allocated to the Ds0Bundle.
When a Ds0Bundle is contained by a E1PhysPathTerm the slots that can be placed in this list are 1 to 31. When a Ds0Bundle is contained by a J1PhysPathTerm then the slots that can be placed in this list are 1 to 24. When a Ds0Bundle is contained by a T1PhysPathTerm then the slots that can be placed in this list are 1 to 24. When a Ds0Bundle is contained by a E1Ttp the slots that can be placed in this list are 1 to 31.
Note: the same timeslot cannot appear more than once in the list! If a E1/J/T1PhysPathTerm contains more than one Ds0Bundle, then the Ds0Bundles listOfTimeSlots must be mutually exclusive (i.e. slots in one list cannot be used in another list).
Note! If the Ds0Bundle is used for carrying SS7 traffic, the listOfTimeSlots can only contain 1 (one) time slot. In this case that is if the Ds0Bundle is reserved by an Mtp2TpAnsi, Mtp2TpItu or Mtp2TpChina.

attribute.name: tdmMode
attribute.description: The state of tdmMode (Time Division Multiplexing), can be disabled/enabled.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO.

class.name: Aal1TpVccTp
class.description:
The Aal1TpVccTp MO represents the Aal1 interworking function in a circuit emulation. The object refers to a Ds0Bundle which represents one end of the circuit emulation, and a VclTp which represents the other end.
Note! The performance monitoring counters in this MO is set to 0 when counterMode is set to PM_MODE_ON. In PM_MODE_OFF no information at all is retrived. So any value for pm-monitoring is measured from the time of setting counterMode to PM_MODE_ON. At node restart these performance monitoring counters is reset to 0.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free tag for marking this managed object.

attribute.name: ds0BundleId
attribute.description: The Ds0Bundle MO that this MO references.

attribute.name: partialFill
attribute.description:
Indicates how many bytes are filled in each ATM cell. The value 47 indicates that the partial filled cells is not used, i.e. all the cells are filled completely.
Partial filling of cells in used in circuit emulation. It is used to reduce packetisation delay. Refer to the ATM Forum specifications for more details.

attribute.name: cdvt
attribute.description:
Specifies the cell delay variation tolerance. Refer to ATM Forum specifications for more details.
Unit is micro seconds.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of Aal1TpVccTp.

attribute.name: continuityCheck
attribute.description:
Continuitiy checking means that a cell is sent downstream when no user cell has been sent for a period of nominally 1 second.
Activates VC end to end continuityCheck according to ITU.T rec I.610.

attribute.name: counterMode
attribute.description: Controls the activation of PM counters and F5 PM flow on the VC connection.

attribute.name: nomPmBlockSize
attribute.description: Nominal performance monitoring (PM) blocksize. The minimum number of ATM cells to send before sending a Forward Performance Monitoring, FPM, cell.

attribute.name: pmFwLostCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for forwarded lost cells.

attribute.name: pmFwMissinsCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of forwarded missinserted cells.

attribute.name: pmFwErrBlocks
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of forwarded errored blocks.

attribute.name: pmLostFpmCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost Forward Performance Monitoring, FPM cells.

attribute.name: pmBwLostCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost backward cells.

attribute.name: pmBwMissinsCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of backward missinserted cells.

attribute.name: pmBwErrBlocks
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of backward errored blocks.

attribute.name: pmLostBrCells
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of lost Backward Reporting, BR, cells.

attribute.name: vclTpId
attribute.description: The VclTp MO that this MO references.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: alarmReport
attribute.description: Attribute to decide what type of alarms to be reported.

class.name: Mtp3bSpAnsi
class.description:
Mtp3b Signalling Point for the ANSI standard.
This MO represents/models the MTP3b Signaling Point characteristics/functions according to the Ansi standard. A signaling point is a logical node in the signaling network. The combination of signaling points and their interconnecting signaling links form the SS No. 7 signaling network. The signaling point represented by this object is a Local Signaling Point.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SpAnsi MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO CREATE SIGNALLING POINTS OF DIFFERENT STANDARDS!
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ANSI standard.
NOTE: The combination of network indicator (networkInd) and Signalling Point Code (signallingPointCode) has to be unique for each Signalling Point.
NOTE: A maximum of 15 instances of this MO can be created on (referencing) the same PlugInUnit.
NOTE: The maximum number of Signalling Points that can be created in a CPP based node is 24.
NOTE: Deleting a singel L3 Signal Point is not possible, if it necessary to delete a Signal Point then all Signal Points has to be deleted. This also has to be done whitin the same transaction.
NOTE: Any object created under a certain SP (Signaling Point) cannot refer to an object created under another SP. Nor can it refer to an object created under another SP.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: rpuId
attribute.description: Holds a reference to the Reliable Program Uniter. The RPU is at the server.

attribute.name: networkInd
attribute.description: The network indicator, NI, is used for discrimination of messages between functionally different networks.

attribute.name: signallingPointCode
attribute.description: The signallingPointCode (Local Point Code) attribute (SPC) is used together with the network indicator (NI, networkInd attribute) to uniquely identify the MTP Signalling Point, SP. SP = NI-SPC. Size (2 exp 24)-1 (16777215). The SignallingPointCode (SPC) is normally grouped together as three numbers wich correspond to network identifier, network cluster, network cluster member. The three numbers are coded as 8-8-8 bits in the total SPC. To enter the SPC-value, you have to convert the 3 numbers to their binary code and then convert the whole 24-bit patterna as an integer. Sometimes the SPC is used as a whole uniqe number (no internal structure).

attribute.name: testPatternSltm
attribute.description:
The testPatternSltm attribute represents a string testpattern in the Signalling Link Test Message.
Minimum string length 2 characters, maximum 30 characters. Allowed characters are 0-9, A-F. Only even number of characters is allowed.

attribute.name: nodeBehaviour
attribute.description: The nodeBehaviour attribute represents the MTP3b node type.

attribute.name: maxSizeReroutBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeReroutBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the rerouting buffer.

attribute.name: maxSizeChangeBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeChangeBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the changeover buffer.

attribute.name: transFrHandler
attribute.description: Determines how a TransFer Restricted signal (TFR) should be treated.

attribute.name: sioSpare
attribute.description: The sioSpare2 attribute determines if the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet) should be treated as spare.

attribute.name: m3uaNoOfAttempsOfDauds
attribute.description: For M3UA, number of attempts to send the DAUD message.

attribute.name: noOfAttempsOfAssociationEstablishment
attribute.description: Number of attempts to send the SCTP_ASSOCIATE_REQ message.

attribute.name: statusIndInterval
attribute.description: The statusIndInterval attribute sets the interval for sending MTP-STATUS indication, i.e. send indication every Nth message .

attribute.name: resendTfcInterval
attribute.description: Send TFC back to originating signalling point code for every n:th message when the destination is congested. Set to 0 will suppress sending of TFC.

attribute.name: sendSltmBefLink
attribute.description:
The sendSltmBefLink attribute determines if the SLTM (Signalling Link Test Message) should be sent and a SLTA received before the link is considered to be in service.
Note! It is not recommended nor is it in accordance with standard to set the value of this attribute to 'false'

attribute.name: spPriority
attribute.description: Struct containing the ANSI priority attributes.

attribute.name: noOfCongestLevelForNI
attribute.description: Defines the number of congestion levels for NI.

attribute.name: routeSetCongestTestFlag
attribute.description:
Selection of which procedure to use during congestion handling if the national option with priorities is used.
0, use TcTimer as described by the TTC standard. 1, use Route Set Congestion Test as described by the ANSI, ITU and China Standard.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operationalState attribute reflects the operational status of the MTP3b SP.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: spTimer
attribute.description: Struct containing ANSI specific timer data.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the reserving MO's. Can be of type SccpSp.

attribute.name: pmNoOfForcedRerouteSuccessPerf
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of successfully performed forced rerouting.

attribute.name: pmNoOfControlledRerouteSuccessPerf
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of successfully performed controlled rerouting.

attribute.name: pmNoOfEmergencyChangeOverRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received emergency changeOver orders (ECO) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfChangeOverRec
attribute.description: Performance counter for number of changeOver order messages (COO/XCO) received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfChangeBackDeclRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received change Back Declarations (CBD) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSLTAFirstTimeOutRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SLTA first time out received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSLTASecondTimeOutRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SLTA second time out received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUPMsgDiscardedDueToRoutingErr
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of UP (user part) messages (MTP_TRANSFER_req) discarded due to routing error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOAXCASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent COA/XCA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECOSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent ECO messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent ECA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOAXCARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received COA/XCA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received CBA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received ECA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfTRARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received TRA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfTRASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent TRA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfTimerT21WasStarted
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of times the timer T21 was started (i.e. how many times the remote inhibit test message has been sent).

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent CBA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessForcedRerouting
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of unsuccessfully performed forced reroutings.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessControlledRerouting
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of unsuccessfully performed controlled reroutings.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocEstablish
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of successful association establishment.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocEstablish
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of unsuccessful association establishment.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpCommunicationErr
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP communication error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpSendFailure
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP send failure.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpBufOverflow
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP stop sending data.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpResumeSending
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP resume sending data.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpNetworkStatusChange
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP network status change.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpAssociationRestart
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP association restart.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocAbort
attribute.description: The number of successful abortions of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocShutDown
attribute.description: The number of succesful shutdowns of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocAbort
attribute.description: The number of unsuccessful abortions of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocShutDown
attribute.description: The number of unsuccesful shutdowns of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIncomingAssocEstabRequestInStateDownWhenStateEstabIsBlocked
attribute.description: The number of incoming request for association establishment when state on the association is 'DOWN' and establishment of associations is blocked.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMaxTrialsForAssocEstabReached
attribute.description: The number of times that the max limit for trying to establish an association has been reached.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMaxTrialsForAssocActivReached
attribute.description: The number of times that the max limit for trying to activate an association has been reached.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLowerPrioMsgDiscarded
attribute.description: The number of messages with low priority that has been discarded.

class.name: Mtp3bSpItu
class.description:
Mtp3b Signalling Point for the ITU standard.
This MO represents/models the MTP3b Signaling Point characteristics/functions according to the ITU standard. A signaling point is a logical node in the signaling network. The combination of signaling points and their interconnecting signaling links form the SS No. 7 signaling network. The signaling point represented by this object is a Local Signaling Point.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SpItu MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO CREATE SIGNALLING POINTS OF DIFFERENT STANDARDS!
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ITU standard.
NOTE: The combination of network indicator (networkInd) and Signalling Point Code (signallingPointCode) has to be unique for each Signalling Point.
NOTE: A maximum of 15 instances of this MO can be created on (referencing) the same PlugInUnit.
NOTE: The maximum number of Signalling Points that can be created in a CPP based node is 24.
NOTE: Deleting a singel L3 Signal Point is not possible, if it necessary to delete a Signal Point then all Signal Points has to be deleted. This also has to be done whitin the same transaction.
NOTE: Any object created under a certain SP (Signaling Point) cannot refer to an object created under another SP. Nor can it refer to an object created under another SP.
NOTE: The value of the attribute 'version' is valid for all SPs (Mtp3bSpItu MOs) and the value of the last created or changed SP will be used for all SPs.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: networkInd
attribute.description: The networkInd attribute (NI) is used by signalling message handling functions in MTP3b

attribute.name: signallingPointCode
attribute.description: The signallingPointCode (Local Point Code) attribute (SPC) is used together with the network indicator (NI, networkInd attribute) to uniquely identify the MTP Signalling Point, SP. SP = NI-SPC. Size (2 exp 14)-1 (16383). The SignallingPointCode (SPC) is normally used as a whole unique number (no internal structure). But sometimes the SPC is grouped together as three numbers which corresponds to zone, area/network, signalling point. If this is the case the three numbers are coded as 3-8-3 bits in the total SPC. To enter the SPC-value then you have to convert the three numbers to their binary code and then convert the whole 14-bit pattern as an integer.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description:
This attribute shows what MTP3b ITU standard the system follows. With ITU, it is possible using this attribute to set which of the ITU standard versions that shall be followed.
Note! Setting of another value than 'ITU_T_07_96' at create will have no effect. The Signaling Point will always be created with the value 'ITU_T_07_96'.
Note! It is not possible to hav signaling points with different versions in the node so setting of this attribute will effect all signaling points. The value for the last created or changed signaling point will be used for all signaling points.

attribute.name: nodeBehaviour
attribute.description: The nodeBehaviour attribute represents the MTP3b node type.

attribute.name: noOfCongestLevelForNI
attribute.description: Defines the number of congestion levels for NI.

attribute.name: routeSetCongestTestFlag
attribute.description:
Selection of which procedure to use during congestion handling if the national option with priorities is used.
0, use TcTimer as described by the TTC standard. 1, use Route Set Congestion Test as described by the ANSI, ITU and China Standard.

attribute.name: resendTfcInterval
attribute.description: Send TFC back to originating signalling point code for every n:th message when the destination is congested. Set to 0 will suppress sending of TFC.

attribute.name: maxSizeReroutBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeReroutBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the rerouting buffer.

attribute.name: maxSizeChangeBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeChangeBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the changeover buffer.

attribute.name: transFrHandler
attribute.description: Determines if a TransFer Restricted signal (TFR) should be treated as a TFA (TransFer Allowed signal) or be ignored.

attribute.name: sioSpare
attribute.description: The sioSpare2 attribute determines if the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet) should be treated as spare.
