attribute.name: statusIndInterval
attribute.description: The statusIndInterval attribute sets the interval for sending MTP-STATUS indication, i.e. send indication every Nth message .

attribute.name: sendSltmBefLink
attribute.description:
The sendSltmBefLink attribute determines if the SLTM (Signalling Link Test Message) should be sent and a SLTA received before the link is considered to be in service.
Note! It is not recommended nor is it in accordance with standard to set the value of this attribute to 'false'

attribute.name: testPatternSltm
attribute.description:
The testPatternSltm attribute represents a string testpattern in the Signalling Link Test Message.
Minimum string length 2 characters, maximum 30 characters. Allowed characters are 0-9, A-F. Only even number of characters is allowed.

attribute.description: Struct containing the priority attributes.

attribute.name: spTimer
attribute.description: Struct containing ITU specific timer attributes

attribute.description: Holds a reference to the Reliable Program Uniter. The RPU is at the server.

This MO represents/models the MTP3b Signaling Point characteristics/functions according to the TTC standard. A signaling point is a logical node in the signaling network. The combination of signaling points and their interconnecting signaling links form the SS No. 7 signaling network. The signaling point represented by this object is a Local Signaling Point.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SpTtc MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the TTC standard.
NOTE: IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO CREATE SIGNALLING POINTS OF DIFFERENT STANDARDS!
NOTE: The combination of network indicator (networkInd) and Signalling Point Code (signallingPointCode) has to be unique for each Signalling Point.
NOTE: A maximum of 15 instances of this MO can be created on (referencing) the same PlugInUnit.
NOTE: The maximum number of Signalling Points that can be created in a CPP based node is 24.
NOTE: Deleting a singel L3 Signal Point is not possible, if it necessary to delete a Signal Point then all Signal Points has to be deleted. This also has to be done whitin the same transaction.
NOTE: Any object created under a certain SP (Signaling Point) cannot refer to an object created under another SP. Nor can it refer to an object created under another SP.

class.name: Mtp3bSlAnsi
class.description:
This MO represents an MTP3b Signalling Link for the ANSI standard. It represents the termination of the signalling link within the signalling point as defined in T1.111-1996.
The total amount of links between any two specific nodes in the network shall not be more than 80 independent on how many linksets that are defined between the two nodes. The signalLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on which linkSet the link belongs to. A maximum of five linksets with a maximum of 16 links in each linkset can be configured. A maximum of 16 links between two adjacent nodes can be configured.
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ANSI standard.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SlAnsi MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: This attribute reflects the operational status of the Mtp3bSlAnsi.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: tpId
attribute.description:
The tpId attribute points out the termination point of the lower layer protocol.
For narrowband this signalling link will be connected to an MTP L2 termination point (Mtp2Tp MO). And for broadband it will be connected to a NNI SAAL termination point (NniSaalTp Mo).

attribute.name: linkState
attribute.description:
The link state of the Mtp3bSlAnsi.
The link state is a bit map which contains a combination of the following values: (in hexadecimal format)
0x00 Available 0x01 Failed 0x02 Remotely blocked 0x04 Locally blocked 0x08 Remotely inhibited 0x10 Locally inhibited 0x20 Deactivated

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
There are three possible states for the usageState attribute:
- idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic. - active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested. - busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

attribute.name: signLinkCode
attribute.description: The signalling link code, SLC, used for this link. The signLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on in which linkSet the link belongs.

attribute.name: proceduralState
attribute.description:
The procedural state of the link.
0 - not initialized 1 - initialized

attribute.name: linkCongestLevel
attribute.description: The congestion level of the link.

attribute.name: autoStartLink
attribute.description: Controls if the Mtp3bSL should be activated at create.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALINServiceInd
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received link-in-service indications.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALOUTInd
attribute.description:
Performance management counter for number of received link-out-of-service indications.
Note! This counter is incremented every time a link out of service indication is received for the link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOOXCOSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent change over order (COO/XCO) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBDSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent CBD messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestCeaseRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion ceased primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSURec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of received MSU's on this signalling link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUSent
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of sent MSU's on this signalling link.

action.name: deactivate
action.description:
This action deactivates the signalling link. It will also set autoStartLink = false.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: activate
action.description:
This action activates the signalling link with normal alignment. It will also set autoStartLink = true.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: emergencyActivate
action.description:
This action activates the signalling link with emergency alignment. It will also set autoStartLink = true
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: localInhibit
action.description:
This action inhibits the Mtp3bSlAnsi. Signalling link management inhibiting is requested by management when it becomes necessary, e.g for maintenance or testing purposes to make or keep a signalling link unavailable to User Part-generated signalling traffic. Inhibiting of a signalling link may be requested by management function at either end of the link. The request is granted, provided that the inhibiting action does not cause any previously accessible destinations to become inaccessible at either end of the signalling link. The request may also be refused under certain circumstances such as congestion. Exception FroRequestFailed if it was not possible to inhibit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: localUninhibit
action.description:
This action uninhibits the Mtp3bSlAnsi.
Exception FrorequestFailed if it was not possible to uninhibit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Mtp3bSlItu
class.description:
This MO represents an MTP3b Signalling Link for the ITU standard. It represents the termination of the signalling link within the signalling point as defined in Q.704 and Q.2210 (07/96).
The total amount of links between any two specific nodes in the network shall not be more than 16, independent on how many linksets that are defined between the two nodes. The signalLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on which linkSet the link belongs to.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SlItu MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the ITU standard.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: tpId
attribute.description:
The tpId attribute points out the termination point of the lower layer protocol.
For narrowband this signalling link will be connected to an MTP L2 termination point (Mtp2Tp MO). And for broadband it will be connected to a NNI SAAL termination point (NniSaalTp Mo).

attribute.description: This attribute reflects the operational status of the Mtp3bSl.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus

The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

The link state is a bit map which contains a combination of the following values: (in hexadecimal format)
0x00 Available 0x01 Failed 0x02 Remotely blocked 0x04 Locally blocked 0x08 Remotely inhibited 0x10 Locally inhibited 0x20 Deactivated

attribute.description:
There are three possible states for the usageState attribute:
- idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic. - active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested. - busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

attribute.name: signLinkCode
attribute.description: The signalling link code, SLC, used for this link. The signLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on in which linkSet the link belongs.

attribute.name: proceduralState
attribute.description:
The procedural state of the link.
0 - not initialized 1 - initialized

attribute.name: linkCongestLevel

attribute.name: autoStartLink
attribute.description: Controls if the Mtp3b Signalling Link should be activated at create.

attribute.name: prioBeforeSio
attribute.description:
This Boolean tells if the message priority shall be inserted in an octet before the Service Indicator Octet (SIO).
ITU default is false.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALINServiceInd
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received link-in-service indications.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALOUTInd
attribute.description:
Performance management counter for number of received link-out-of-service indications.
Note! This counter is incremented every time a link out of service indication is received for the link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOOXCOSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent change over order (COO/XCO) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBDSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent CBD messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestCeaseRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion ceased primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSURec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of received MSU's on this signalling link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUSent
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of sent MSU's on this signalling link.

action.name: localInhibit
action.description:
This action inhibits the Mtp3bSlItu. Signalling link management inhibiting is requested by management when it becomes necessary, e.g for maintenance or testing purposes to make or keep a signalling link unavailable to User Part-generated signalling traffic. Inhibiting of a signalling link may be requested by management function at either end of the link. The request is granted, provided that the inhibiting action does not cause any previously accessible destinations to become inaccessible at either end of the signalling link. The request may also be refused under certain circumstances such as congestion. Exception FroRequestFailed if it was not possible to inhibit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: emergencyActivate

Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Mtp3bSlTtc
class.description:
This MO represents an MTP3b Signalling Link for the TTC standard. It represents the termination of the signalling link within the signalling point as defined in JT-Q.704 Ver. 3, April 28 1992 and JT-Q.2210 Ver.1 April 24 1996.
The total amount of links between any two specific nodes in the network shall not be more than 16, independent on how many linksets that are defined between the two nodes. The signalLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on which linkSet the link belongs to.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SlTtc MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the TTC standard.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: tpId
attribute.description: The tpId attribute points out the termination point of the lower layer protocol. Only BroadBand is supported for TTC. The MO will be connected to a NNI SAAL termination point (NniSaalTp Mo).

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: This attribute reflects the operational status of the Mtp3bSl.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: linkState

The link state is a bit map which contains a combination of the following values: (in hexadecimal format)
0x00 Available 0x01 Failed 0x02 Remotely blocked 0x04 Locally blocked 0x08 Remotely inhibited 0x10 Locally inhibited 0x20 Deactivated

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:

- idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic. - active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested. - busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

attribute.name: signLinkCode
attribute.description: The signalling link code, SLC, used for this link. The code have to be uniqe in this signal link set, i.e the signallingLinkCode for all the Mtp3bSl that belongs to the same Mtp3bSls must be unique(mutual exclusive).

attribute.name: proceduralState

The procedural state of the link.
0 - not initialized 1 - initialized

class.name: Mtp2ProfileAnsi
class.description: The MTP 2 Profile MO represents and keeps attribute values used by one or more MTP 2 ANSI termination point MOs.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: This MOs user label.

attribute.name: profileData
attribute.description: Struct containing profile data.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of Mtp2TpAnsi MOs that have reserved this Mtp2TpProfileAnsi MO.

class.name: Mtp2ProfileItu
class.description: The MTP 2 Profile MO represents and keeps attribute values used by one or more MTP 2 ITU termination point MOs.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: The MOs user label.

attribute.name: profileData
attribute.description: Struct containing profile data.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of Mtp2TpItu MOs that have reserved this Mtp2TpProfileItu MO.

class.name: E1Ttp
class.description:
This MO represents a channelised E1 interface in the node. The E1Ttp (Trail Termination Point) MO does not define which type of traffic (TDM or ATM) that the interface should support. Please refer to the Ds0Bundle, AtmPort, IMALink and IMAGroup objects for details about configuration of traffic type.
The performance monitoring counters in the E1Ttp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.
Note! This MO is automatically created as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtpMo Please refer to the Os155SpiTtpMo for more details.

attribute.name: degDegThr
attribute.description:
The threshold decides how many of the received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made on a per-second basis and if the threshold is passed the second is considered bad.
This is a percentage value.

attribute.name: degDegM
attribute.description: How many bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: crc4Mode
attribute.description: Indicates what Cyclical Redundancy Check 4 Mode that is being used.

attribute.name: idlePattern
attribute.description:
The idle pattern.
NOTE: Going from A_LAW or U_LAW to UNDEFINED is always allowed but setting up one ET board with both U_LAW and A_LAW is not allowed. E.g. If you want to change from A_LAW to U_LAW on one ET board you have to change idlePattern on each physical port belonging to the board to UNDEFINED first. A_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> U_LAW or U_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> A_LAW

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter of Errored Seconds (ES).

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Severely Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identityof the reserving MO.

attribute.name: reservedByImaLink
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving ImaLink MO.

class.name: Vc4Ttp
class.description:
This MO is automatically created as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtp object if any of the following conditions are true: a) standardmode = ETSI or b) standardmode = TTC and muxmode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL.
It represents the termination of the SDH VC-4 path layer. The VC-4 can either be used for channelised access, in which case VC-12 MOs are created as children to the Vc4Ttp MO, or be used to carry ATM traffic, in which case there is a relationship between the AtmPort MO and the Vc4Ttp MO.
Note! The performance monitoring counters in the Vc4TtpMO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large to fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: pathTraceFormat
attribute.description:
Indicates the format of the expectedPathtrace and transmittedPathtrace attributes. The format may be in 16 or 64 characters. Usually 16 is used for ETSI and 64 for ANSI/TTC.
ITU_T_G707=16 GR_253_CORE=64
Note that the 16 characters format requires the operator to specify 15 characters where no character contains the null character (the 16th character is added automatically).
Note that the 64 characters format requires the operator to specify 62 ASCII characters all different from null followed by CR/LF.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace. Can be defined in two formats. The format may be in 16 or 64 characters. Usually 16 is used for ETSI and 64 for ANSI/TTC.
Note: The string must be of 15 or 62 characters length, or empty string ("").

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
Expected path trace.
The string can be of 15 or 62 characters length, or empty string ("").
Note: An empty string for this attribute means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) should be disabled. This attribute is set to empty string every time attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, i.e. for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
True - enabled. False - disabled.

attribute.name: vcDegThreshold
attribute.description:
This threshold decides how many of the received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made on a per-second basis and if the threshold is passed the second is considered bad.
The attribute value is in unit of % (percent).

attribute.name: vcDegM
attribute.description: Indicates how many bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: auAisReporting
attribute.description:
AU AIS reporting.
True - enable reporting. False - disable reporting.

attribute.name: vcRdiReporting
attribute.description:
VC RDI reporting.
True - enable reporting. False - disable reporting.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmVcEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Virtual Container 4, VC4, Errored Seconds, ES.

attribute.name: pmVcSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Virtual Container 4, VC4, Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO.

class.name: Os155SpiTtp
class.description:
This MO represents the physical interface and the termination of the SDH Regenerator and Multiplexer Section Layers.
When creating the Os155SpiTtp a number of additional objects will be created. Depending on the values of standardmode and muxmode different objects will be created as described below:
muxmode = standby standardmode = ETSI, TTC, ANSI No objects under the Os155SpiTtp is created.
muxmode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL standardmode = ETSI, TTC A Vc4 MO is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
muxmode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL standardmode = ANSI A Sts3CspeTtp MO is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
The following two configurations is only applicable for the ET-MC41 board.
muxmode = E1_J1_T1_LEVEL standardmode = ETSI A Vc4 MO, 63 Vc12Ttp MO's and 63 E1Ttp MO's is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO
muxmode = E1_J1_T1_LEVEL standardmode = ANSI 3 Sts1CspeTtp MO's, 3*28 Vt15Ttp MO's and 3*28 TiTtp MO's is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
The performance monitoring counters in the Os155SpiTtp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is too large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.
Note! If the Os155SpiTtp is configured as part of an Mspg protection group and is configured as standby, muxMode set to standby, no children's to this MO will be created.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description: The actual line number.

attribute.name: standardMode
attribute.description: The standard that this MO is operating to.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: muxMode
attribute.description:
The level at which the STM-1/OC3 signal is demultiplexed.
If parent is of type Etmc41, the valid muxMode is STANDBY or E1_J1_T1_LEVEL. If parent is of type Etm4, the valid muxMode is STANDBY or VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL.

attribute.name: msDegThreshold
attribute.description:
MS - multiplexer section.
The threshold decides how many of the received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made on a per-second basis and if the threshold is passed the second is considered bad.
This is a percentage value.
Note: When operating to the ANSI standard, this attribute has no meaning.

attribute.name: msDegM
attribute.description:
MS - multiplexer section.
How many bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.
Note: When operating to the ANSI standard, this attribute has no meaning.

attribute.name: msRdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: msAisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: loopBack
attribute.description:
Enables or disables line loopback, i.e. the received signal is returned in the transmitted direction.
none - This is the normal state, no loop back is performed (and ordinary traffic is running).
line - The physical path is looped on the line side, the external incoming path is looped back to the external outgoing path.
Note! administrativeStatus must be set to locked when setting loopback attribute.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmMsEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Multiplexer Section, MS, Errored Seconds, ES.

attribute.name: pmMsSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Multiplexer Section, MS, Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving MOs.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving Synchronization MO.

class.name: Vc12Ttp
class.description:
This MO is automatically created when the configuring the Os155SpiTtp. It represents the termination of the SDH VC-12 path layer.
Note: This MO is only valid when the ETSI standard is in use.
The performance monitoring counters in the Vc12TtpMO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace.
Note: when 16 byte tracing is used, only 15 bytes should be used in the set action for this attribute.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
Expected path trace.
Note: when 16 byte tracing is used, only 15 bytes should be used in the set action for this attribute.
Note: An empty string for this attribute means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) should be disabled.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, i.e. for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
True - enabled. False - disabled.

attribute.name: vcDegThreshold
attribute.description:
This threshold decides how many of the received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made on a per-second basis and if the threshold is passed the second is considered bad.
The attribute value is in unit of % (percent).

attribute.name: vcDegM
attribute.description: Indicates how many bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: tuAisReporting
attribute.description:
Timing Unit Alarm Indication Signal (TU AIS) reporting.
True - enable reporting. False - disable reporting.

attribute.name: vcRdiReporting
attribute.description:
VC RDI reporting.
True - enable reporting. False - disable reporting.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmVcEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Virtual Container 12, VC12, Errored Seconds, ES.

attribute.name: pmVcSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Virtual Container 12, VC12, Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

class.name: Etmc1
class.description:
This MO represents the hardware of the ET-MC1 board type. It only represents the ET specific hardware, the DBM module of the board is represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The ET-MC1 board contains 8 phyiscal ports that can be configured as either E1 (ETSI), J1 (TTC) or T1(ANSI). The board does not allow for a mix of E1, J1 and T1 ports, thus all configured ports on the board must be configured to the same standard.
Each port on the ET-MC1 board can be used to carry either ATM traffic or circuit orientated (Nx64 Kbits/s connections) traffic.
Each port can support up to 30 ATM VC connections. Two of these connections are reserved for AAL2 paths, and therefore two AAL2 multiplexers per port are available.
Each port can support up to 2 VP connections.
The ET-MC1 port supports one bidirectional F4/F5 PM flow per port.
At the VP/VC endpoints, the Lost FPM/BR cells counters are not available.
Note! The ETMC1 supports IMA.
For more details on restrictions please refer to 155 17-21/CSX 101 09 Uen.
Note! When the Etmc1 is part of the Cbu it is only possible to configure 4 physical ports of type E1, J1 or T1 on the Etmc1 board.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the ETMC1 board.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: Etmc41
class.description:
This MO represents the hardware of the ET-MC41 board type. It only represents the ET specific hardware, while the DBM module of the board is represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The ET-MC41 board contains a 155 Mbits/s physical optical port. The board can be configured as a E1 channelised board providing 63 logical E1 interfaces.
Each E1 logical channel on the ET-MC41 can be used to carry either ATM traffic or circuit oriented (Nx64 kbit/s) traffic.
Each E1 logical channel can support up to 30 ATM VC connections. Two of these connections are reserved for aal2 paths, and therefore two AAL2 multiplexers per E1/DS1/J1 channel are available.
Each E1/DS1/J1 channel can suport up to 2 VP connections.
The ET-MC41 board support one biderectional F4/F5 PM flow per E1 channel.
Note! The ETMC41 supports IMA. However the E1 ports being part of the same IMA group can not be selected randomly.
Note! The number of VCC TP+VPC TP with performance monitoring enabled (i.e. PM mode <> off) is restricted to 1 / port
For more details on restrictions please refer to 155 17-21/CSX 101 09 Uen.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the ET-MC41 board.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: Mtp2ProfileChina
class.description: The MTP2 Profile MO represents and keeps attribute values used by one or more MTP2 China termination point MOs.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of Mtp2TpChina MOs that have reserved this Mtp2TpProfileChina MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: The MOs user label.

class.name: Mtp2TpChina
class.description:
This MO represents a MTP 2 termination point for the China standard, as defined in GF001-9001, plus supplement 1-3.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp2China MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is a hardware fault, aal1 server/adm restart or node restart.
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contained by or dependent on) an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the China standard.
NOTE: There is a restriction of a maximum of 32 Mtp2Tp's per MP.

attribute.name: ds0BundleId
attribute.description: The Ds0Bundle MO that this MO references.

attribute.name: mtp2ProfileChinaId
attribute.description:
Reference to a Mtp2ProfileChina MO.
Note: The bitRate can not be changed.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the MTP2 Signalling Terminal.

attribute.name: pmLocalSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in local SIB (Sending).

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of MSUs transmitted.

attribute.name: pmNoOfNacks
attribute.description: Number of negative acknowledgements received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuReceivedInError
attribute.description: Number of signal units received in error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfReTransmittedOctets
attribute.description: Number of re-transmitted octets.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSendBufferOctets
attribute.description: Number of octets in send buffer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFReceived
attribute.description: Number of SIO and SIF octets received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSIOSIFTransmitted
attribute.description: Number of SIO & SIF octets transmitted.

attribute.name: pmNoOfStartedRBCongestion
attribute.description: Number of started local RB congestions.

attribute.name: pmRemoteSIBTime
attribute.description: Total time in remote SIB (Receiving).

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Free tag for marking this managed object.

attribute.name: plugInUnitId
attribute.description:
The PlugInUnit MO that this MO references. It indicates on which processor the Termination Point will be.
Note: The PlugInUnit must be of type GPB.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUReceived
attribute.description: Number of MSUs received..

class.name: Mtp3bSlChina
class.description:
This MO represents an MTP3b Signalling Link for the China standard. It represents the termination of the signalling link within the signalling point as defined in GF001-9001, plus supplement 1-3.
The total amount of links between any two specific nodes in the network shall not be more than 16, independent on how many linksets that are defined between the two nodes. The signalLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on which linkSet the link belongs to.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SlChina MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard that is NOT the China standard.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: This attribute reflects the operational status of the Mtp3bSl.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: autoStartLink
attribute.description: Controls if the Mtp3b Signalling Link should be activated at create.

attribute.name: linkCongestLevel
attribute.description: The congestion level of the link.

attribute.name: linkState
attribute.description:
The link state of the Mtp3bSl.
The link state is a bit map which contains a combination of the following values: (in hexadecimal format)
0x00 Available 0x01 Failed 0x02 Remotely blocked 0x04 Locally blocked 0x08 Remotely inhibited 0x10 Locally inhibited 0x20 Deactivated

attribute.name: prioBeforeSio
attribute.description:
This Boolean tells if the message priority shall be inserted in an octet before the Service Indicator Octet (SIO).
China default is false.

attribute.name: proceduralState
attribute.description:
The procedural state of the link.
0 - not initialized 1 - initialized

attribute.name: signLinkCode
attribute.description: The signalling link code, SLC, used for this link. The signLinkCode for a link must be unique between the nodes, independent on in which linkSet the link belongs.

attribute.name: tpId
attribute.description:
The tpId attribute points out the termination point of the lower layer protocol.
For narrowband this signalling link will be connected to an MTP L2 termination point (Mtp2Tp MO). And for broadband it will be connected to a NNI SAAL termination point (NniSaalTp Mo).

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
There are three possible states for the usageState attribute:
- idle, the Mtp3bSl carries no traffic. - active, the Mtp3bSl is working normally, and there is traffic, and it is not congested. - busy, the Mtp3bSl is working but is congested (traffic is routed on other links).

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALINServiceInd
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received link-in-service indications.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAALOUTInd
attribute.description:
Performance management counter for number of received link-out-of-service indications.
Note! This counter is incremented every time a link out of service indication is received for the link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBDSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent CBD messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOOXCOSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent change over order (COO/XCO) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestCeaseRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion ceased primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLocalLinkCongestRec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of local link congestion primitives received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSURec
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of received MSU's on this signalling link.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMSUSent
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of sent MSU's on this signalling link.

action.name: activate
action.description:
This action activates the Mtp3bSl with normal alignment. It will also set autoStartLink = true.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: deactivate
action.description:
This action deactivates the Mtp3bSl. It will also set autoStartLink = false.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: emergencyActivate
action.description:
This action activates the Mtp3bSl with emergency alignment. It will also set autoStartLink = true
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: localInhibit
action.description:
This action inhibits the Mtp3bSlChina. Signalling link management inhibiting is requested by management when it becomes necessary, e.g for maintenance or testing purposes to make or keep a signalling link unavailable to User Part-generated signalling traffic. Inhibiting of a signalling link may be requested by management function at either end of the link. The request is granted, provided that the inhibiting action does not cause any previously accessible destinations to become inaccessible at either end of the signalling link. The request may also be refused under certain circumstances such as congestion. Exception FroRequestFailed if it was not possible to inhibit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: localUninhibit
action.description:
This action uninhibits the Mtp3bSlItu.
Exception FrorequestFailed if it was not possible to uninhibit.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Mtp3bSpChina
class.description:
Mtp3b Signalling Point for the China standard.
This MO represents/models the MTP3b Signaling Point characteristics/functions according to the China standard. A signaling point is a logical node in the signaling network. The combination of signaling points and their interconnecting signaling links form the SS No. 7 signaling network. The signaling point represented by this object is a Local Signaling Point.
The performance monitoring counters found in Mtp3SpChina MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is shutdown request from CLI (Cluster Interface).
NOTE: IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO CREATE SIGNALLING POINTS OF DIFFERENT STANDARDS!
NOTE: This MO cannot in anyway be related (either contain or by dependence) to an MO that belongs to a standard which is NOT the China standard.
NOTE: The combination of network indicator (networkInd) and Signalling Point Code (signallingPointCode) has to be unique for each Signalling Point.
NOTE: A maximum of 15 instances of this MO can be created on (referencing) the same PlugInUnit.
NOTE: The maximum number of Signalling Points that can be created in a CPP based node is 24.
NOTE: Deleting a singel L3 Signal Point is not possible, if it necessary to delete a Signal Point then all Signal Points has to be deleted. This also has to be done whitin the same transaction.
NOTE: Any object created under a certain SP (Signaling Point) cannot refer to an object created under another SP. Nor can it refer to an object created under another SP.

attribute.name: maxSizeChangeBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeChangeBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the changeover buffer.

attribute.name: maxSizeReroutBuf
attribute.description: The maxSizeReroutBuf attribute represents the maximum size (in kB) of the rerouting buffer.

attribute.name: networkInd
attribute.description: The network indicator, NI, is used for discrimination of messages between functionally different networks.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operationalState attribute reflects the operational status of the MTP3b SP.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the reserving MO's. Can be of type SccpSp.

attribute.name: sendSltmBefLink
attribute.description:
The sendSltmBefLink attribute determines if the SLTM (Signalling Link Test Message) should be sent and a SLTA received before the link is considered to be in service.
Note! It is not recommended nor is it in accordance with standard to set the value of this attribute to 'false'

attribute.name: signallingPointCode
attribute.description: The signallingPointCode (Local Point Code) attribute (SPC) is used together with the network indicator (NI, networkInd attribute) to uniquely identify the MTP Signalling Point, SP. SP = NI-SPC. Size (2 exp 24)-1 (16777215). The SignallingPointCode (SPC) is nornally used as a whole unique number (no internal structure). But sometimes the SPC is grouped together as three numbers which corresponds to zone, area/network, signalling point. If this is the case the three numbers are coded as 8-8-8 bits in the total SPC. To enter the SPC-value then you have to convert the three numbers to their binary code and then convert the whole 24-bit pattern as an integer.

attribute.name: nodeBehaviour
attribute.description: The nodeBehaviour attribute represents the MTP3b node type.

attribute.name: noOfCongestLevelForNI
attribute.description: Defines the number of congestion levels for NI.

attribute.name: routeSetCongestTestFlag
attribute.description:
Selection of which procedure to use during congestion handling if the national option with priorities is used.
0, use TcTimer as described by the TTC standard. 1, use Route Set Congestion Test as described by the ANSI, ITU and China Standard.

attribute.name: resendTfcInterval
attribute.description: Send TFC back to originating signalling point code for every n:th message when the destination is congested. Set to 0 will suppress sending of TFC.

attribute.name: sioSpare
attribute.description: The sioSpare attribute determines if the two spare bits in the SIO (Service Information Octet) should be treated as spare.

attribute.name: spPriority
attribute.description:
Struct containing the priority attributes.
Note: The China and ITU priorityData is identical so the ItuPriorityData is used for China to avoid duplication of data.

attribute.name: spTimer
attribute.description: Struct containing China specific timer attributes

attribute.name: statusIndInterval
attribute.description: The statusIndInterval attribute sets the interval for sending MTP-STATUS indication, i.e. send indication every Nth message .

attribute.name: testPatternSltm
attribute.description:
The testPatternSltm attribute represents a string testpattern in the Signalling Link Test Message.
Minimum string length 2 characters, maximum 30 characters. Allowed characters are 0-9, A-F. Only even number of characters is allowed.

attribute.name: transFrHandler
attribute.description: Determines if a TransFer Restricted signal (TFR) should be treated as a TFA (TransFer Allowed signal) or be ignored.

attribute.name: rpuId
attribute.description: Holds a reference to the Reliable Program Uniter. The RPU is at the server.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: m3uaNoOfAttempsOfDauds
attribute.description: For M3UA, number of attempts to send the DAUD message.

attribute.name: noOfAttempsOfAssociationEstablishment
attribute.description: Number of attempts to send the SCTP_ASSOCIATE_REQ message.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description:
This attribute shows what MTP3b ITU standard the system follows. With ITU, it is possible using this attribute to set which of the ITU standard versions that shall be followed.
Note! Setting of another value than 'ITU_T_07_96' at create will have no effect. The Signaling Point will always be created with the value 'ITU_T_07_96'.
Note! It is not possible to hav signaling points with different versions in the node so setting of this attribute will effect all signaling points. The value for the last created or changed signaling point will be used for all signaling points.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received CBA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCBASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent CBA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfChangeBackDeclRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received change Back Declarations (CBD) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfChangeOverRec
attribute.description: Performance counter for number of changeOver order messages (COO/XCO) received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOAXCARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received COA/XCA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCOAXCASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent COA/XCA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfControlledRerouteSuccessPerf
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of successfully performed controlled rerouting.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent ECA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received ECA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfECOSent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent ECO messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfEmergencyChangeOverRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received emergency changeOver orders (ECO) messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfForcedRerouteSuccessPerf
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of successfully performed forced rerouting.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSLTAFirstTimeOutRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SLTA first time out received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSLTASecondTimeOutRec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SLTA second time out received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfTimerT21WasStarted
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of times the timer T21 was started (i.e. adjacent SP restarted).

attribute.name: pmNoOfTRARec
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of received TRA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfTRASent
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of sent TRA messages.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessControlledRerouting
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of unsuccessfully performed controlled reroutings.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessForcedRerouting
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of unsuccessfully performed forced reroutings.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUPMsgDiscardedDueToRoutingErr
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for number of UP (user part) messages (MTP_TRANSFER_req) discarded due to routing error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocEstablish
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of successful association establishment.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocEstablish
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of unsuccessful association establishment.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpCommunicationErr
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP communication error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpSendFailure
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP send failure.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpBufOverflow
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP stop sending data.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpResumeSending
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP resume sending data.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpNetworkStatusChange
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP network status change.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSctpAssociationRestart
attribute.description: Performance management counter for number of SCTP association restart.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocAbort
attribute.description: The number of successful abortions of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSuccessAssocShutDown
attribute.description: The number of succesful shutdowns of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocAbort
attribute.description: The number of unsuccessful abortions of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfUnsuccessAssocShutDown
attribute.description: The number of unsuccesful shutdowns of signalling associations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIncomingAssocEstabRequestInStateDownWhenStateEstabIsBlocked
attribute.description: The number of incoming request for association establishment when state on the association is 'DOWN' and establishment of associations is blocked.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMaxTrialsForAssocEstabReached
attribute.description: The number of times that the max limit for trying to establish an association has been reached.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMaxTrialsForAssocActivReached
attribute.description: The number of times that the max limit for trying to activate an association has been reached.

attribute.name: pmNoOfLowerPrioMsgDiscarded
attribute.description: The number of messages with low priority that has been discarded.

class.name: Mspg
class.description:
The MSPG (Multiplex Section Protection Group) object enables two different protection mechanism in Cello. First it enables a standard 1+1 MSP mechanism. A failure on the working line will thus cause a sub 50 ms switch to the standby line. Secondly the MSPG is used to enable equipment protection, whereas a failure of the working board will cause a switch to the standby board. While executing an equipment protection switch, the node on the other end of the multiplexer section, will experience a standard 1+1 MSP switch.
It is possible to force traffic to one port/board by using administrative state. Setting administrative state to locked on the working board, will automatically cause an equipment switch to the standby board. Similarily setting administrative state to locked on the working port, will cause an MSP switch to the standby port.
The process of configuring a MSP protection interface is as follows: 1) Create the working interface as normal. 2) Create the standby interface by creating an Os155SpiTtp with mux mode set to STANDBY (standby for protection). 3) Create a MSPG object with references to the two Os155SpiTtp objects.
Note! The ports selected for MSPG must be have the attribute standardMode configured in exactly the same way.
Note! The Os155SpiTtp created for standby will not create any children, i.e no Vc4Ttp or Vc4Ttp, Vc12Ttp and E1Ttp will be created. Nor will object of type Sts1SpeTtp, Vt15Ttp or T1Ttp be created.

attribute.name: os155SpiWorkingId
attribute.description:
The working OS155 pyhiscal path termination. This is the administrative value.
To retrive the Id of the current working port, use the selectedPort.

attribute.name: os155SpiStandbyId
attribute.description: The standby OS155 physical path termination. This is the administrative value.

attribute.name: switchMode
attribute.description: The switching mode.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Mspg.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: selectedPort
attribute.description: The port currently selected by the MSPG. The selected port can only change due to a MSP or equipment switch.

attribute.name: selectedBoard
attribute.description: The board currently providing the user traffic interface to the Cello switch. The only action that can change the selected board is an equipment switch.

attribute.name: degCauseMsp
attribute.description: If set to true, then a swith is performed upon detection of DEG.

action.name: manualMspSwitch
action.description:
Initiates a switch when there does not exist a defect.
This action can fail for the following reasons: FailedResource - the switch was not possible due to a traffic affecting fault on the port to which the switch was requested (i.e. the one not currently selected). LockedResource - the port to which the switch is intended is administratively locked. UnknownReason - there exists another fault that prevents the action.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: T1PhysPathTerm
class.description: This MO represents an T1 (i.e. 1.5 Mbit/s) physical interface in the node. The T1PhysPathTerm MO does not define which type of traffic (TDM or ATM) that the interface should support. Please refer to the Ds0Bundle, AtmPort, IMALink and IMAGroup objects for details about configuration of traffic type.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description: The actual Line number on the board.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description:
Possible values
none - This is the normal state, no loop back is performed (and ordinary traffic is running).
line - The physical path is looped on the line side, the external incoming path is looped back to the external outgoing path.
system - The physical path is looped on the system side, the (node-) internal incoming path is looped back to the internal outgoing path.
Note! administrativeStatus must be set to locked when setting loopback attribute.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Errored Seconds, ES.

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Severly Errored Seconds, SES.

attribute.name: reservedByTraffic
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving AtmPort MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Physical Line Termination.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: idlePattern
attribute.description:
The idle pattern.
NOTE: Going from A_LAW or U_LAW to UNDEFINED is always allowed but setting up one ET board with both U_LAW and A_LAW is not allowed. E.g. If you want to change from A_LAW to U_LAW on one ET board you have to change idlePattern on each physical port belonging to the board to UNDEFINED first. A_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> U_LAW or U_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> A_LAW

attribute.name: transmissionMode
attribute.description: The type of transmission media. Refer to the TransmissionMode enumeration for details.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving Synchronization MO.

attribute.name: reservedByImaLink
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving ImaLink MO.

class.name: ImaGroup
class.description:
IMA, Inverse Multiplexing for ATM, makes it possible to group several physical interfaces together to form a virtual physical pipe for atm. The capacity of this pipe is equal to the sum of each of the physical interfaces included in the group.
When IMA should be configured, an ATMPort MO is created with reference to an IMAGroup MO rather than a pure physical interface MO. The IMAGroup MO in turn is created with a list of the physical port MO's that are included in the group. The physical port MO's must be of the same type and be located on the same ET board.
For each of the physical port MO's included in the IMAGroup, an IMALink object is automatically created. The IMALink object is responsible for handling link specific performance and fault management related to IMA.
The ports can be of type E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, E1Ttp, T1Ttp.
The performance monitoring counters in the ImaGroup MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.
Note! A general restriction in Cello is that ports being part of the same IMA group must be located on the same board.
Note! Only termination points on Etmc1 and Etmc41 boards are allowed as ImaLinks.
Note! At least two links has to be configured in an Ima Group.

attribute.name: ImaGroupId
attribute.description: The identity of the MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: physicalPortList
attribute.description: Holds a list of the physical ports connected to the ImaGroup. Can be of type: E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, E1Ttp, T1Ttp.

attribute.name: requiredNumberOfLinks
attribute.description: The required number of links specifies the number of IMALinks that needs to be operational in order for the complete group to be operational. The bandwidth available for the ATMPort (and thus for creating VP/VC connections) is defined by this number. Setting the requiredNumberOfLinks field to K less than the number of physical links included in the IMAGroup, will reduce the bandwidth available to the atmport with the corresponding bandwidth but will also give the effect that K links failures can be tolerated with virtually no traffic disturbance.

attribute.name: activeLinks
attribute.description: The number of active links in the ImaGroup.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the ImaGroup.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmGrUasIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the GrUasLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmGrFc
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the GrFc attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmGrFcFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the GrFcFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO.

class.name: ImaLink
class.description:
This MO is automatically created as a consequence of creating an IMAGroup or adding links to an IMAGroup. It provides IMA Link specific performance and fault management information.
The links can be of type E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, E1Ttp or T1Ttp.
The performance monitoring counters in the ImaLink MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.
Note! A general restriction in Cello is that ports being part of the same IMA group must be located on the same board.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the ImaLink. If the operationalState is disabled the ImaLink will be blocked for traffic.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmIvIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the LvLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: ImaLinkId
attribute.description: The identity of the MO.

attribute.name: pmOifIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the OifLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmSesIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the SesLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmSesImaFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the SesLmaFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmUasIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the UasLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmUasImaFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the UasLmaFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmTxUusIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the TxUusLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmRxUusIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the RxUusLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmTxUusImaFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the TxUusLmaFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmRxUusImaFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the RxUusLmaFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmTxFc
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the TxFc attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmRxFc
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the RxFc attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmTxFcFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the TxFcFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmRxFcFe
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the RxFcFe attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmTxStuffIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the TxStuffLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: pmRxStuffIma
attribute.description: This performance counter reflects the RxStuffLma attribute as defined by Inverse Multiplexing for ATM(IMA) specification ver. 1.1, AF-PHY-0086.001

attribute.name: uses
attribute.description: Reference to the physical port represented by this MO. Can be of types E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, E1Ttp or T1Ttp.

class.name: Sts3CspeTtp
class.description:
This MO represents the termination of the SONET higher order paths. This MO is automatically created when creating the OS155SPITTP with mux mode set to VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL and standardMode set to ANSI.
The performance monitoring counters in the Sts3CspeTtp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large to fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User label for free use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Sts3CspeTtp.

attribute.name: aisPReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiPReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, i.e. for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
True - enabled. False - disabled.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
Expected path trace.
The string can be of 64 characters length, or empty string (""). The string shall consist of 62 ASCII characters followed by CR/LF. The empty string shall be coded with the first character equal to ASCII null (i.e. byte value 0) and the rest dummy or non-existing.
Note: An empty string for this attribute means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) should be disabled. This attribute is set to empty string every time attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace.
The string shall consist of 62 ASCII characters followed by CR/LF. The empty string shall be coded with the first character equal to ASCII null (i.e. byte value 0) and the rest dummy or non-existing.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Identity of the AtmPort reserving this MO.

attribute.name: pmEsp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for ES, Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: pmSesp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

class.name: WebServer
class.description:
The WebServer MO represents the WebServer in the node.
This object is used for configuration of the WebServer paths. By connecting this object to a SwAllocation MO that is connected to a Repertoire MO the WebServer paths will be automatically configured during system upgrade.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, WebServer=1.
The WebServer MO is created automatically by the system.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: webServerPaths
attribute.description: Paths that shall be used by the WebServer separated by the delimiter character ":".

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description: List of reserving MOs.

class.name: IpAccessAutoConfig
class.description: This MO represents the Auto Configuration feature for the IpAccessHost's in Cello.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Hold a list of the identitys of the reserving IpAccessHost's.

attribute.name: networkPrefix
attribute.description:
The network prefix.
The prefix denotes how many bits that are used for calculating the subnet mask.

attribute.name: nrOfUnusedAdresses
attribute.description: The number of addresses in the range that are not used.

attribute.name: totalNrOfAddresses
attribute.description:
The total number of addresses in the range.
Note that the first address in the range will be the same one as the one for networkAddress.

attribute.name: minIpAddress
attribute.description: The lowest value that can be used as host IP address. If autoConfig=ON for an IpAccessHost, the operator does not explicitly have to assign an Ip Address and prefixLength to the host. This is done by the Control Plane, based on the IpAccesAutoConfig identity specified for the IpAccessHost.

attribute.name: maxIpAddress
attribute.description: The highest value that can be used as host IP address. If autoConfig=ON for an IpAccessHost, the operator does not explicitly have to assign an Ip Address and prefixLength to the host. This is done by the Control Plane, based on the IpAccesAutoConfig identity specified for the IpAccessHost.

class.name: IpAccessHostMsb
class.description:
This MO represents the Ip Access Host used for payload. This host type executes on a MSB board (Media Stream Board used by Media Gateway).
Note! If autoConfig is set to ON, the Ip Addresses and the Prefixes for this MO is set by the IpAccessAutoConfig MO.
Note! There can be a maximum of 128 host's in the node.
Note! The references to Aal5TpVccTp MO's has to be set in pairs.
Note! The IpAccessMsbHost must execute on the sam MP as the Aal5TpVccTp that are defined in the attributes 'aal5TpVccTpRef1' and 'aal5TpVccTpRef2'.
Note! The 'administrativeState' has to be set to LOCKED in order to be able to delete this host.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Ip Access Host.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the Ip Access Host.

attribute.name: shutDownTimer
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: dspId
attribute.description:
The identity of the DSP (Digital Signalling Processor) on a MSB board.
Note! The value of this attribute has to be unique among the host's that execute on the same board.

attribute.name: aal5TpVccTpRef1
attribute.description:
Holds a reference to an Aal5 termination point (Aal5TpVccTp MO).
Note! The Aal5TpVccTp references are mutually exclusive.

attribute.name: aal5TpVccTpRef2
attribute.description:
Holds a reference to an Aal5 termination point (Aal5TpVccTp MO).
Note! The Aal5TpVccTp references are mutually exclusive.

attribute.name: autoConfig
attribute.description: This attribute specifies whether the auto configuration feature for the Ip Access Host is used or not.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
Note! This attribute can only be set if 'autoConfig' is set to 'ON'.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The IpAddress.
Note! If autoConfig = OFF this attribute is mandatory.
Note! If the autoConfiguration is used for this IpAccessHost (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set. This attribute is then set by the 'IpAccessAutoConfig MO'.
Note! The IpAddress has to be unique within the node.

attribute.name: networkPrefix
attribute.description:
The network prefix.
The prefix denotes how many bits that are used for calculating the subnet mask.
Note! If auto configuration is used (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set, the networkPrefix is then set in the ipAccessAutoConfig MO class.
Note! If auto configuration is not used (autoConfig = OFF) this attribute must be set.

attribute.name: linkStatusAddress
attribute.description: The link Status for Ip Address.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description:
The maximum transfer unit.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.

attribute.name: ipDefaultTtl
attribute.description:
The default value inserted into the Time-To-Live field of the IP header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.

attribute.name: pmIpInReceives
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.

attribute.name: pmIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.

attribute.name: pmIpInAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (e.g., 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported Classes (e.g., Class E). For entities which are not IP routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.

attribute.name: pmIpInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of locally-addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

attribute.name: pmIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly.

attribute.name: pmIpInDelivers
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP).

attribute.name: pmIpOutRequests
attribute.description: The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams

attribute.name: pmIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter would include datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors

attribute.name: pmIcmpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).

attribute.name: pmIcmpInDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInParamProbs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInSrcQuenchs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Source Quench messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInRedirects
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Redirect messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer such as the inability of IP to route the resultant datagram.
