In some implementations there may be no types of error which contribute to this counter's value.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutParmProbs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages sent.

attribute.name: pmUdpInDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.

attribute.name: pmUdpNoPorts
attribute.description: The total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpOutDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO.

attribute.name: plugInUnitId
attribute.description:
Holds a reference to the PlugInUnit.
Note that the 'plugInUnitId has to be the same as the one defined in the attribute 'processorId' found on the Aal5TpVccTpMo.

class.name: Aal2QosProfile
class.description: This MO represents the definitions of properties for a set of Aal2 quality of service classes.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: profileClassA
attribute.description: This attribute holds the values applicable for QoS Class A.

attribute.name: profileClassB
attribute.description: This attribute holds the values applicable for QoS Class B.

attribute.name: profileClassC
attribute.description: This attribute holds the values applicable for QoS Class C.

attribute.name: profileClassD
attribute.description: This attribute holds the values applicable for QoS Class D.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: List of reserving Aal2PathVccTp MOs.

class.name: Aal2QosCodePointProfile
class.description: This MO represents the QoS CodePoints for the different Aal2 QoS classes.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: qualityOfServiceCodePointA
attribute.description:
The Code Point for Class A.
Recommended value for Class A, 128.

attribute.name: qualityOfServiceCodePointB
attribute.description:
The Code Point for Class B.
Recommended value for Class B, 129.

attribute.name: qualityOfServiceCodePointC
attribute.description:
The Code Point for Class C.
Recommended value for Class C, 130.

attribute.name: qualityOfServiceCodePointD
attribute.description:
The Code Point for Class D.
Recommended value for Class D, 131.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds the identity of the reserving Aal2Ap Mo.

class.name: M3uAssociation
class.description:
This MO represents the M3UA Association part of the M3UA (MTP3-User Adaptaion Layer) that is a protocol for the transport of any SS7 MTP3-User signalling (e.g., ISUP and SCCP messages) over IP using the services of the Stream Control Transmission Protocol.
Note that the local port number is hard coded to 2905.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the reserving Signaling Route's (Mtp3bSr MO).

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The Operational State of the M3Ua

attribute.name: mtp3bSrsId
attribute.description: The identity of the Signalling Route Set used.

attribute.name: sctpId
attribute.description: The SctpHost used by this association.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description:
The DSCP, DiffServCodePoint, for the internal M3UA user. Only one DSCP value is valid and set by the first defined MO 'instance'.
NOTE: The value set for the 'dscp' when creating the first M3uAssociation under a signaling point will also be used for all other M3uAssociation MO's that are created under this signaling point. So setting the value for the 'dscp' on other instances than the first one created will have no effect. Note that associations created under a different signaling point can have a different dscp-value.

attribute.name: associationState
attribute.description:
The possible states of an M3Ua association.
Bit 1 = 1 indicates INACTIVE Bit 2 = 1 indicates ACTIVE Bit 3 = 1 indicates ESTABLISHED Bit 4 = 1 indicates DOWN
These values are mutually exclusive.

attribute.name: localIpMask
attribute.description:
This attribute denotes whether single or multi homing is used.
Note! that all M3uAssociations that refers to the same SCTP MO must have this attribute set to the same value.
Note! If localipMask=2 or localipMask=3 . the attribute ipAddress2 or autoConfigIdentity2 in IpAccessHostGpb MO must be defined.

attribute.name: autoStartAssociation
attribute.description: If true, the M3ua layer in the stack will after a restart, start up all signalling associations.

attribute.name: remotePortNumber
attribute.description: The port number of the remote signalling point (SP).

attribute.name: remoteIpAddress1
attribute.description:
Remote IpAddress 1, if not used the value should be an empty string. Range is 0.0.0.0 - 255.255.255.255
Note! This address is concidered as the primary IP-address. In case of association establisment failure 'remoteIpAddress2' will be used.

attribute.name: remoteIpAddress2
attribute.description:
Remote IpAddress 2, if not used the value should be an empty string. Range is 0.0.0.0 - 255.255.255.255
Note! This address cannot be the same as remoteIpAddress1. This address is used when trying to establish association in case association attempt using 'remoteIpAddress1' fails.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCommunicationLost
attribute.description: Number of communication losses.

attribute.name: pmNoOfCongestions
attribute.description: Number of congestions.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDunaRec
attribute.description: Number of DUNA messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDavaRec
attribute.description: Number of DAVA messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSconRec
attribute.description: Number of SCON messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDupuRec
attribute.description: Number of DUPU messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDataMsgSent
attribute.description: The number of data messages sent on the associations related to this signalling point.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDunaSent
attribute.description: Number of DUNA messages sent through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDavaSent
attribute.description: Number of DAVA messages sent through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfSconSent
attribute.description: Number of SCON messages sent through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDupuSent
attribute.description: Number of DUPU messages sent through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDataMsgRec
attribute.description: Number of DATA (payload data) messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfErrorMsgRec
attribute.description: Number of ERROR messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfErrorMsgSent
attribute.description: Number of ERROR messages sent through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfNotifyMsgRec
attribute.description: Number of NOTIFY messages received through the association.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDaudMsgSent
attribute.description: The number of daud messages sent on the associations related to this signalling point.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDaudMsgRec
attribute.description: The number of daud messages received on the associations related to this signalling point.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspupSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPUP sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspupReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPUP received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspdnSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPDN sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspdnReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPDN received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspacSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPAC sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspacReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPAC received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspiaSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPIA sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspiaReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPIA received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspupAckSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPUP_Ack sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspupAckReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPUP_Ack received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspdnAckSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPDN_Ack sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspdnAckReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPDN_Ack received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspacAckSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPAC_Ack sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspacAckReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPAC_Ack received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspiaAckSent
attribute.description: The number of ASPIA_Ack sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfAspiaAckReceived
attribute.description: The number of ASPIA_Ack received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfM3uaDataMsgDiscarded
attribute.description: The number of data Messages discarded.

action.name: setAutoActivate
action.description:
This action starts the association.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

action.name: setAutoDown
action.description:
This action stops the association.
Note! This action requires a transaction.

class.name: Sctp
class.description: This MO represents the SCTP, Stream Control Transmission Protocol in Cello. SCTP is designed to transport signaling messages over IP networks.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Ip Access Host.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: numberOfAssociations
attribute.description: The maximum number of M3uAssociations that can be handled by this SCTP MO.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the M3Ua's handled by the SCTP.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostGpbId
attribute.description: The identity of the IpAccessHostGbp reserved by this MO.

attribute.name: minimumRto
attribute.description:
The minimum value for RTO (Retransmission time-out). The minimumRto shall be larger than tSack + expected Round Trip Time.
Unit is second/100.

attribute.name: maximumRto
attribute.description:
The maximum value for RTO (Retransmission time-out).
Unit is second/100.
maximumRto must be larger than minimumRto.

attribute.name: initialRto
attribute.description:
The initial value that the RTO (Retransmission time-out) will take prior to the first RTT (Round Trip Time) measure.
Note that the value for 'initialRto' has to be equal to or greater than 'minimumRto'.
Unit is seconds/100.

attribute.name: rtoAlphaIndex
attribute.description:
This parameter is used for computing the value of the SRTT (Smoothed Round Trip Time) for a specific destination address. Is is used to weight the RTT values, and it's value must be between 0 and 1 (0 < rtoAlpha < 1). A value close to 1 gives a higher importance to the last RTT measurement. The range of possible values in the configuration file and the actual value given to this parameter within the module are the following:
rtoAlphaIndex = 1 -> RTO-Alpha = 1/2 rtoAlphaIndex = 2 -> RTO-Alpha = 1/4 rtoAlphaIndex = 3 -> RTO-Alpha = 1/8 rtoAlphaIndex = 4 -> RTO-Alpha = 1/16

attribute.name: rtoBetaIndex
attribute.description:
This parameter is used for computing the the value of RTTVar (Round Trip Time Variation) of a destination address. It's value must be between 0 and 1 (0 < rtoBetaIndex < 1). A value close to 1 gives more importance to the last observed variation. The range of possible values in the configuration file and the actual value given to this parameter within the module are the following:
rtoBetaIndex = 1 -> RTO-Beta = 1/2 rtoBetaIndex = 2 -> RTO-Beta = 1/4 rtoBetaIndex = 3 -> RTO-Beta = 1/8 rtoBetaIndex = 4 -> RTO-Beta = 1/16

attribute.name: validCookieLife
attribute.description:
This parameter sets up the lifespan of the State Cookie sent in the INIT_ACK chunk. It is used for limiting the the valid amount of time between sending the INIT_ACK and the reception of a COOKIE_ECHO chunk when establishing an association. If a COOKIE_ECHO chunk arrives after 'validCookieLife' has expired when sending an INIT_ACK chunk, the COOKIE_ECHO shall be discarded and no association will be established.
Unit is seconds.

attribute.name: allowedIncrementCookieLife
attribute.description:
The sender of an INIT chunk may request to the remote endpoint a cookie life-span increase (for example, if a previous attempt to connect failed due to a state-cookie error). If the value sent in the "Cookie Preservative field" of the INIT chunk is less or equal to this parameter, the reciver of the INIT chunk will increase the 'validCookieLife' with the number of seconds specified. If the value present in the "Cookie Preservative field" is higher than this parameter, the cookie life should be incremented with the number of seconds specified by the parameter.
Unit is seconds.

attribute.name: keyChangePeriod
attribute.description:
Defines how often the secret key used for computing the MAC (Message Authentication Code) on the State Cookie is changed.
Unit is seconds.

attribute.name: associationMaxRtx
attribute.description:
This is the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote peer (on all the destination transport addresses of the peer, if it's multi homed). If the number of retransmissions becomes higher than this value, the remote peer shall be considered unreachable and the association shall be closed down.
The value of this attribute should be greater than, or equal to the value of the attribute 'pathMaxRtx'.
Note that for a specific association, it might happen that all the remote addresses (if the the remote end is multi homed) becomes unreachable without exceeding the 'associationMaxRtx'. In such a case the association will be closed down.
Note! The value need to be increased to avoid frequent CommLost's in case of an unstable network.

attribute.name: pathMaxRtx
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote transport address. If the number of retransmissions becomes higher than this value, the remote transport address shall be considered as "inactive" and no data shall be sent to it. If all of the remote transport addresses becomes "inactive", tha association will be closed down.
Note! The value need to be increased to avoid frequent CommLost's in case of an unstable network.

attribute.name: maxInitialRtrAtt
attribute.description: The maximum nimber of retransmissions allowed for both INIT and COOKIE_ECHO chunks. If the number of retransmissions exceeds this value, then the SCTP must abort the initialization of the association and report the error to the user.

attribute.name: maxShutDownRtrAtt
attribute.description: The maximum number of retransmission during the shutdown phase of an association.

attribute.name: heartbeatInterval
attribute.description:
The amount of time added to the RTO (Retransmission Time Out) of a specific address when setting up the period of time between sending heartbeats. Small values can lead to an earlier detection of unreachable addresses than higher values. Note that sendig often might lead to performace penalty.
Unit is seconds.

attribute.name: heartbeatStatus
attribute.description:
This attribute enables/disables heartbeats for associations.
True = Enables

attribute.name: maxIncomingStream
attribute.description: This is the maximum incoming streams (MIS) for an association. Established associations might have an IS less or equal to this, but it's MIS can never be higher than the value of this attribute.

attribute.name: maxOutgoingStream
attribute.description: The maximum number of outgonig streams for an association.

attribute.name: maxUserDataSize
attribute.description:
The maximum number of bytes a user is allowed to pass as a non fragmentable user data in a SCTP_SEND_REQ message (fixed user MTU): The values for this attribute is 'user' data and do not include IP header (20 bytes), SCTP header (12 bytes) or DATA chunk header (16 bytes).
Unit is bytes.

attribute.name: mBuffer
attribute.description:
This attribute sets the size of the buffer used for storing user data pending to be sent or retransmitted in an association. I.e. establish the maximum amount of user data that SCTP shall buffer before discarding user messages.
The Unit is in kilo bytes.
Note! The restriction on this attribute is: mBuffer x number of M3uAssociation MOs connected to this Sctp + 20 Mb <= the heap for Sctp program.
Note! The value may need to be increased to ensure stable dataflow at high load.

attribute.name: nThreshold
attribute.description:
This attribute sets the value of the threshold used by SCTP to stop the delivery of data on anassociation. Once nThreshold or more bytes are queued and pending to be sent, the SCTP layer shall issue an indication to the user. The value of nThreshold should be less than mBuffer in order to be effective. A normal value for nThreshold is 3/4 * mBuffer.
Unit is kilo bytes.
Note! The value may need to be increased to ensure stable dataflow at high load.

attribute.name: tSack
attribute.description:
The delay of sending the SACK. I.e. the time from DATA chunk reception to Sack chunk sending.
Unit is second/100

attribute.name: maxDataSizeIp
attribute.description:
The maximum number of bytes SCTP shall be able to fetch every time it reads from the socket.
Note! This value includes the Ip header, 20 bytes.

attribute.name: initialAdRecWin
attribute.description:
The value of the initial advertised reciver window.
Note! The range is 1500 to maxDataSizeIp.
Unit is bytes.

attribute.name: intervalOobPkts
attribute.description:
The number of seconds for the interval for which the counter for out of the blue chunks will be reset.
Unit is seconds.

attribute.name: intervalLostUser
attribute.description: The number of seconds for the interval for which the SCTP will decide that the SCTP user that lost the connection is dead. After the time specified in this attribute has elapsed, all associations related to the SCTP user will be destroyed.

attribute.name: maxBurst
attribute.description: The number of packages that will be sent during the fast retransmit phase when a SACK is processed.

attribute.name: nPercentage
attribute.description: The size of 'n' inpercentage when SCTP_CONGESTION_CEASE_IND is sent. At 100 percent the primitive will buffer usage goes below 'nThreshold'.

attribute.name: bundlingActivated
attribute.description: This attribute enables/disables the use of bundling. Valid values: 1: enabled. 0: disabled.

attribute.name: bundlingTimer
attribute.description: This attribute specifies maximum SCTP bundling delay. Value=0 means that SCTP will only bundle what is available and send directly (no delay). Unit is milliseconds

attribute.name: pmSctpCurrEstab
attribute.description: Number of SCTP associations for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED, SHUTDOWN-PENDING, or SHUTDOWN-RECEIVED.

attribute.name: pmSctpActiveEstab
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISHED state from the COOKIE-ECHOED state.

attribute.name: pmSctpPassiveEstab
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISHED state from the CLOSED state.

attribute.name: pmSctpAborted
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from any state using the primitive ABORT.

attribute.name: pmSctpShutdowns
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SHUTDOWN-SENT state or the SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT state.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatAssocOutOfBlue
attribute.description: Number of out of the blue packets (SCTP packet correctly formed-right checksum- but the receiver is not able to identify the association to which this packet belongs) received by the host.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentChunks
attribute.description: Number of complete data chunks sent to the peers (no retransmissions included).

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRecChunks
attribute.description: Number of complete data chunks received from the peers (no retransmissions included).

attribute.name: pmSctpStatOutOfOrderSendChunks
attribute.description: Number of unordered chunks sent to the peers.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatOutOfOrderRecChunks
attribute.description: Number of unordered chunks received from the peers.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatChecksumErrorCounter
attribute.description: Number of SCTP packets received from the peers with an invalid checksum.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRetransChunks
attribute.description: Number of data chunks retransmitted to the peers.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentControlChunks
attribute.description: Number of datagrams sent with chunk type id > 0.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReceivedControlChunks
attribute.description: Number of datagrams Receivedwith chunk type id > 0.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatFragmentedUserMsg
attribute.description: Number of fragmented user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of a fragmented message is sent.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReassembledUserMsg
attribute.description: Number of reassembled user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of a fragmented message is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentPackages
attribute.description: Number of SCTP packages sent.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReceivedPackages
attribute.description: Number of SCTP packages Received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatCommStop
attribute.description: Number of times the SCTP has sent a communication stop indication to the user.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatCommResume
attribute.description: Number of times SCTP has sent a communication resume indication to the user.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentChunksDropped
attribute.description: Number of sent chunks that SCTP has been forced to drop due to buffer overflow in the sending buffer.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRecChunksDropped
attribute.description: Number of received chunks that SCTP has been forced to drop due to buffer overflow in the receiving buffer.

class.name: Sts1SpeTtp
class.description:
This MO represents the termination of the SONET higher order paths. This MO is automatically created when creating the OS155SPITTP with mux mode set to E1_J1_T1_LEVEL and standardmode set to ANSI.
The performance monitoring counters in the Sts1SpeTtp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large to fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Sts3CspeTtp.

attribute.name: aisPReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiPReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, i.e. for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
True - enabled. False - disabled.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
Expected path trace.
The string can be of 64 characters length, or empty string ("").
Note: An empty string for this attribute means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) should be disabled. This attribute is set to empty string every time attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace. Can be defined in two formats. The format may be in 16 or 64 characters. Usually 16 is used for ETSI and 64 for ANSI/TTC.
Note: The string must be of 15 or 62 characters length, or empty string ("").

attribute.name: pmEsp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for ES, Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: pmSesp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

class.name: Vt15Ttp
class.description:
This MO is automatically created when the configuring the Os155SpiTtp. It represents the termination of the SONET VP 1.5 path layer.
This MO is automatically created when creating the Os155SpiTtp MO with the following conditions: muxmode = E1_J1_T1_LEVEL standardmode = ANSI
The performance monitoring counters in the Vt15Ttp is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is too large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: aisVreporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiVreporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: shutDownTimer
attribute.description: This timer defines the time that elapses before shut down when administrativeState is se to 'shuttingDown'.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Vt15Ttp MO.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the Vt15Ttp MO.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter of Errored Seconds (ES).

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Serverely Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

class.name: T1Ttp
class.description:
This MO represents a channelised T1 interface in the node. The T1Ttp MO does not define which type of traffic (TDM or ATM) that the interface should support. Please refer to the Ds0Bundle, AtmPort, IMALink and IMAGroup objects for details about configuration of traffic type.
The performance monitoring counters in the T1Ttp MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is to large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.
Note! This MO is automatically created as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtpMo Please refer to the Os155SpiTtpMo for more details.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the T1Ttp MO.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter of Errored Seconds (ES).

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for Serverely Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving AtmPort MO.

attribute.name: reservedByImaLink
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving ImaLink MO.

class.name: E3PhysPathTerm
class.description:
This MO represents an E3 (i.e. 34 Mbit/s) physical interface in the node. Please refer to the AtmPort object for details about configuration of traffic type.
Note! The performance monitoring counters in the E3PhysPathTerm MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is too large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the E3PhysPathTerm.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Physical Line Termination.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description: The actual Line number on the board.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description:
Possible values
none - This is the normal state, no loop back is performed (and ordinary traffic is running).
line - The physical path is looped on the line side, the external incoming path is looped back to the external outgoing path.
system - The physical path is looped on the system side, the (node-) internal incoming path is looped back to the internal outgoing path.
Note! administrativeStatus must be set to locked when setting loopback attribute.

attribute.name: degDegThr
attribute.description:
The threshold decides how many of the received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made on a per-second basis and if the threshold is passed the second is considered bad.
This is a percentage value.

attribute.name: degDegM
attribute.description: How many bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for ES, Errored Seconds.

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for Severely Errored Seconds, SES.

attribute.name: reservedByTraffic
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving AtmPort MO.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving Synchronization MO.

class.name: T3PhysPathTerm
class.description:
This MO represents an T3 (i.e. 45 Mbit/s) physical interface in the node. Please refer to the AtmPort object for details about configuration of traffic type.
Note! The performance monitoring counters in the T3PhysPathTerm MO is set to 0 (zero) at start or restart of the node. When the value is too large too fit in to a long (31bit) the counter turns over and starts from 0 again.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Physical Line Termination.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the T3PhysPathTerm MO.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description: The actual Line number on the board.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description:
Possible values
none - This is the normal state, no loop back is performed (and ordinary traffic is running).
line - The physical path is looped on the line side, the external incoming path is looped back to the external outgoing path.
system - The physical path is looped on the system side, the (node-) internal incoming path is looped back to the internal outgoing path.
Note! administrativeStatus must be set to locked when setting loopback attribute.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Alarm Indication Signal, AIS, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether Remote Defect Indication, RDI, alarms are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: pmEsCpp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for ES, Errored Seconds based on C-bit parity.

attribute.name: pmSesCpp
attribute.description: Performance Monitoring counter for Severely Errored Seconds, SES based on C-bit parity.

attribute.name: reservedByTraffic
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving AtmPort MO.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving Synchronization MO.

class.name: Etm3
class.description:
This MO represents the hardware of the ET-M3 board type. It only represents the ET specific hardware, while the DBM module of the board is represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The ET-M3 board contains 2 physical ports that can be configured as either E3 (ETSI) or T3(ANSI).
Each port on the ET-M3 board can be used to carry ATM traffic.
At the VP/VC endpoints, the Lost FPM/BR cells counters are not available.
IMA is not applicable for theETM3 board.
The ET-M3 board supports eight bidirectional F4/F5 PM flow per port.
The number of VCC TP+VPC TP with performance monitoring enabled (i.e. PM mode <> off) is restricted to 8/port.
Each port can support up to 240 ATM VC connections. Sixteen of these connections are reserved for AAL2 paths, and therefore sixteen AAL2 multiplexers per port are available.
Each port can support up to 16 VP connections.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the Etm3 board.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: SccpApRemote
class.description:
This Managed Object represents an SCCP Remote Access Point. An SCCP AP instance is a logical point in the SCCP network at which an SCCP user can access the services provided by the SCCP and the SCCP can deliver its services to the SCCP user. The SCCP Remote Access Point is identified by a SubSystem Number (SSN).
A remote SccpAp represents an access point in another node and is related to a Mtp3bAp MO.
The performance monitoring counters found in SccpAp MO is reset, set to zero, when the object is created. These counters will not be reset again unless there is a shutdown request from the CLI (Cluster Interface).

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state of the SCCP AP. The operability of the SCCP AP is described by this attribute which has two possible values:
Disabled: The SCCP AP is totally inoperable and unable to provide the service to the user (e.g. if the MTP-3b AP is not usable).
Enabled: The SCCP AP is partly or fully operable and available for use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Holds a list of the reserving MOs.

attribute.name: mtp3bApId
attribute.description: The identity of the Mtp3bAp used by this MO.

attribute.name: ssN
attribute.description:
The sub system number, SSN, of the SCCP Access Point. Note that this has to be a unique number.
The SSN has to be unique among all other SccpApRemote MOs that has the same DPC in their corresponding Mtp3bSrs MOs.

class.name: IpAccessHostGpb
class.description:
This MO represents the Ip Access Host used for payload. This host type executes on a GPB board (GeneralPocessorUnit).
Note! If autoConfig is set to ON, the Ip Addresses and the Prefixes for this MO is set by the IpAccessAutoConfig MO.
Note! There can be a maximum of 128 host's in the node, and only one host on each main processor.
Note! The host cannot be configured on a MP which have a MediumAccessUnit-child MO. They are exclusive.
Note! The 'administrativeState' has to be set to LOCKED in order to be able to delete this host.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: The identity of the reserving MO, can be of type Sctp.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state of the Ip Access Host.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of the Ip Access Host.

attribute.name: shutDownTimer
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer. It is used when the administrativeState is set to shutdown.
Value in seconds, must be a positive value.

attribute.name: linkStatusAddress1
attribute.description: The link status for IpAddress1.

attribute.name: linkStatusAddress2
attribute.description: The link status for IpAddress2, only valid if 2 IpAddresses are configured for this host.

attribute.name: generalProcessorUnitId
attribute.description: Holds a reference to the GPU (GenerelProcessorUnit).

attribute.name: autoConfig
attribute.description: This attribute specifies whether the auto configuration feature for the Ip AccessHost is used or not.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
Note! This attribute is mandatory if 'autoConfig' is set to ON.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity2
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
Note! This attribute can only be set if 'autoConfig' is set to 'ON'. This attribute is not neccesary to set if 'autoConfig' is set to ON, unless the host shall have two Ip Addresses automatically assigned.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The IpAddress.
Note! If autoConfig = OFF this attribute is mandatory. Note! If the autoConfiguration is used for this IpAccessHostGpb (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set. This attribute is then set by the 'IpAccessAutoConfig MO'. Note! If the attribute is set, its value must not be the same as for attribute ipAddress2.

attribute.name: ipAddress2
attribute.description:
The second IpAddress.
Note! If autoConfig = OFF this attribute is possible to set. This attribute should only be set if multi-homing is used for this host (i.e. two addresses defined). Note! If the autoConfiguration is used for this IpAccessHostGpb (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set. This attribute is then set by the 'IpAccessAutoConfig MO'. Note! If the attribute is set, its value must not be the same as for attribute 'ipAddress'.

attribute.name: pathMTUDiscovery
attribute.description:
Specifies whether path MTU discovery should be used by this host.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description:
The maximum transfer unit.
The MTU has a initial value of 1452 if pathMTUDiscovery is set to false. If pathMTUDiscovery is set to true, the initial value of MTU is 1452.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.

attribute.name: ipDefaultTtl
attribute.description:
The default value inserted into the Time-To-Live field of the IP header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.

attribute.name: ipReasmTimeout
attribute.description:
The maximum number of seconds which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this entity.
Note! in order to be able to set the value for this attribute, the administrative state has to be locked.
Note! The value for this attribute has to be positive.

attribute.name: nextHopIpAddr
attribute.description: The next hop IP address.

attribute.name: nextHopIpAddr2
attribute.description:
The secondary next hop IP address.
Note! This attribute must only be set if one of the following conditions are fulfilled: 1. Attribute 'ipAddress2' is set. 2. Attribute 'autoConfig' = 'ON' and attribute 'autoConfigIdentity2' is set.

attribute.name: networkPrefix
attribute.description:
The network prefix.
The prefix denotes how many bits that are used for calculating the subnet mask.
Note! The default value 0 (zero) is most likely not possible to use and an other value should be submitted if this attribute is configured manually. Note! If auto configuration is not used (autoConfig = OFF) this attribute must be set (i.e. this attribute is then 'mandatory'). Note! If auto configuration is used (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set, networkPrefix is then set by the ipAccessAutoConfig MO class.

attribute.name: networkPrefix2
attribute.description:
The second network prefix.
The prefix denotes how many bits that are used for calculating the subnet mask.
Note! The default value 0 (zero) is most likely not possible to use and an other value should be submitted if this attribute is configured manually. Note! If auto configuration is not used (autoConfig = OFF) and ipAddress2 is set this attribute must be set (i.e. this attribute is then 'mandatory'). Note! If auto configuration is used (autoConfig = ON) this attribute cannot be set, networkPrefix2 is then set by the ipAccessAutoConfig MO class.

attribute.name: pmIpInReceives
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.

attribute.name: pmIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.

attribute.name: pmIpInAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (e.g., 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported Classes (e.g., Class E). For entities which are not IP routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.

attribute.name: pmIpInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of locally-addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

attribute.name: pmIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly.

attribute.name: pmIpInDelivers
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP).

attribute.name: pmIpOutRequests
attribute.description: The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams

attribute.name: pmIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter would include datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmReqds
attribute.description: The number of IP fragments received which needed to be reassembled at this entity.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams successfully re-assembled.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmFails
attribute.description: The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc). Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IP fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received.

attribute.name: pmIpFragOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at this entity.

attribute.name: pmIpFragFails
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this entity but could not be, e.g., because their Don't Fragment flag was set.

attribute.name: pmIpFragCreates
attribute.description: The number of IP datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at this entity.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages which the entityreceived. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors

attribute.name: pmIcmpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).

attribute.name: pmIcmpInDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInParamProbs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInSrcQuenchs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Source Quench messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInRedirects
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Redirect messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages which this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer such as the inability of IP to route the resultant datagram. In some implementations there may be no types of error which contribute to this counter's value.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutParmProbs
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages sent.

attribute.name: pmUdpInDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.

attribute.name: pmUdpNoPorts
attribute.description: The total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpOutDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of out unicast packets delivered to higher layer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of input packets discarded due to any error.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of input broadcast packets delivered to higher layer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of input multicast packets delivered to higher layer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of output broadcast packets delivered to higher layer.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of output multicast packets delivered to higher layer.

class.name: SystemFunctions
class.description:
This MO structures the SystemFunctions of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The local distinguished name of this MO is ManagedElement=1, SystemFunctions=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

class.name: Licensing
class.description: This MO represents the Licensing (Software Keys) functions in Cello.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: emergencyStateInfo
attribute.description:
This attribute holds information about the emergency status and the time remaining in the current state.
Note! If the node is in emergency state USE_DEGRADED, or the emergency state is USE_DISABLED, the the value of'time' is insignificant.

attribute.name: licenseFileUrl
attribute.description:
This attribute returns the URL to the License Key File so it can be viewed with an XML capable web browser in case this is a licensed node.
Note! In case the node is not licensed, an empty string will be returned.

action.name: updateLicenseKeyFile
action.description:
This action sends a request to the FTP/SFTP server to update the license key file.
User Id for login to FTP/SFTP server where license key files are located. If a null string userId is given, anonymous FTP/SFTP transfer is assumed. Max length is 20 characters.
Password for login to the FTP/SFTP server where license key files are located. Max length is 20 characters.
The IpAddress of the FTP/SFTP server where license key files are located. Max length is 16 characters.
Source name and path of the license key file on the FTP/SFTP server. Max length is 256 charcters.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

action.name: setEmergencyState
action.description:
This action sets the license server into emergency state. I.e. opens up all licensed features and capacity restrictions. Disabling emergency state is done by loading a new license key file.
Note! This action does not require a transaction.

class.name: TimingUnit2
class.description:
This MO represents a timing unit2 (reference clock) in the node.
The corresponding Program shall be of LoadModuleLoaderType, SpmFpgaLoader.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Operational state of TimingUnit

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the TimingUnit.
The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

class.name: SccpPolicing
class.description:
The SccpPolicing MO represents the policing function in CPP.
The originatingMtp3bSpc is a madatory attribute for policing in one local node (i.e. a SRP in one NI). For policing between two local nodes (i.e. a SRP between two NIs) the originatingMtp3bSpc can be replaced by the originatingSccpSpId. Optional attributes for policing in one local node (i.e a SRP in one NI) are destinationMtp3bSpc, destinationSccpSsn, originatingSccpSsn and policingGlobalTitle. For policing between two local nodes (i.e. a SRP between two NIs) the destinationMtp3bSpc can be replaced by the destinationSccpSpId.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: originatingMtp3bSpc
attribute.description:
The value of the SPC (Signaling Point Code).
Note! If the 'originatingSccpSpId' is specified the 'originatingMtp3bSpc' is invalid.

attribute.name: destinationMtp3bSpc
attribute.description:
The value of the destination SPC (Signaling Point Code).
Note! The default value 0 (zero) means that no SPC is defined. Note! If no 'destinationSccpSp' is defined and the value of 'destinationMtp3bSpc' is set to 0 (zero), all Signalling Point Codes (SPC) are valid.

attribute.name: originatingSccpSpId
attribute.description:
The identity of the originating SccpSp MO must be used for policing between local nodes.
Note! If the 'originatingSccpSpId' is specified the 'originatingMtp3bSpc' is invalid.

attribute.name: originatingSccpSsn
attribute.description:
The value of SSN in CgPA (Calling Party Address)
Note! The value 0 (zero) means that all ssN (Sub System Number) are valid.

attribute.name: destinationSccpSpId
attribute.description:
The identity of the destination SccpSp MO can be used for policing between local nodes.
Note! If the 'destinationSccpSpId' is specified the 'destinationMtp3bSpc' is invalid. Note! If no destination 'destinationSccpSp' is defined and the value of 'destinationMtp3bSpc' is set to 0, all local nodes are valid.

attribute.name: destinationSccpSsn
attribute.description:
The value of SSN inCdPA (Called Party Address).
Note! The valu 0 (zero) means tha all ssN (Sub System Number) are valid.

attribute.name: policingGlobalTitle
attribute.description:
The Policing Global Title attribute allows to optionally police on Global Title
Default value is considered as no policing Global Title and all GTs are valid.

attribute.name: discardOrReturnServiceMsg
attribute.description: For a policing case whether to discard or return Service Messages, if the return option is set.

attribute.name: pmNoOfRejectMsg
attribute.description: Performance monitoring counter for the number of rejected messages.

class.name: SccpAccountingCriteria
class.description:
The SccpAccountingCriteria MO and the SccpSp MO represents the accounting function in CPP.
Attribute usageType specifies Accounting Remuneration (incoming GT messages) or Verification (outgoing GT messages).
For Remuneration a SccpGlobalTitle MOId in attribute globalTitleId must be defined. For Verification a SccpGlobalTitle MOid is defined in attribute globalTitleId, or a SccpEntitySet MOid is defined if accounting shall be made on the resulting new GT.
The attribute ssN is optional . The Mtp3bSrs MOid (including an SPC) in attribute pointerId is optional for accounting in one local node (SRP in one NI). The SccpSp MOid in attribute pointerId is optional for accounting between two local nodes (SRP between two NIs). Attribute countType specifies if Messages och Octets shall be counted. Start and stop of accounting and output period for the accounting file is specified in the SccpSp MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label free for use.

attribute.name: usageType
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies if the MO is used for renumeration or verification.
0 = Verification Criteria to detect outgoing massages that will be charged in the next relay node.
1 = Renumeration Criteria to detect incoming messages for relaying, that will be charged.

attribute.name: ssN
attribute.description: Subsystem Number this Accounting Criteria applies to. SubSystem Number 0 (zero) means that any SSN in CdPA (Called Party Address) is valid.

attribute.name: countType
attribute.description: Specifies type of countes that should be activated.

attribute.name: globalTitleId
attribute.description: The identity of the SccpGlobalTitle MO or the SccpEntitySet MO used by this MO.

attribute.name: pmNoOfMsg
attribute.description:
Performance monitoring counter for the number of messages, both incoming and outgoing.
Note! If 'countType' is set to 'OCTETS' this counter is not valid.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOctets
attribute.description:
Performance monitoring counter for the number of octets, both incoming and outgoing.
Note! If 'countType' is set to 'MESSAGES this counter is not valid.

attribute.name: pointerId
attribute.description:
The pointer is an instance of a Mtp3bSrs MO OR an instance of a SccpSP MO.
Note! If no pointerId is set all Signaling Point Codes (SPC) and all Sccp SP identities are valid. Note! It is not possible to submit the Id of the SccpSp that the SccpAccountingCriteria belongs to.

class.name: Cbu
class.description:
This MO models the Cbu (Node Control Board) board in CPP. The Cbu board integrates the functionality of TUB, SCB, GPB and ETB (ET-MC1) into one Plug-In Unit.
Note! The 'operationalState' is set to disabled if one of the functional parts is faulty. Even if the Cbu is marked with 'operationalState' DISABLED, parts of the Cbu can still be operational.
Note! A functional part on a Cbu board can only be redundant with the same functional part on another Cbu board and thus not with that functional part implemented on a discrete board. Also note that redundancy is only applicable for the GPB part and the TimingUnit part of the Cbu board..
Note! On the Cbu board it is only possible to configure a maximum of 4 physical path terminations. These can be of type E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhyspathTerm or T1PhyspathTerm. It is not possible to create physical path terminations of different standards on the same board.
Note! The Gpu part of the Cbu board (General Processor Unit) retrieves its 'availabilityStatus' from the PlugInUnit MO, thus not represented on the Cbu MO.
Note! When the ET-MC1 is part of the Cbu board it is only possible to configure 4 physical ports as either E1 (ETSI), J1 (TTC) or T1 (ANSI).
Note! This unit may only be inserted in slot 1 and 24 (or more accurately at APN=1 and 0 in a non-standard subrack). If redundant configuration is needed, two Cbu's must be inserted in the subrack. If only one Cbu is used it must be placed in slot 1 (in a non-standard subrack) to be able to read the product information data of the subrack

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description:
Provides the possibility to put a user-friendly label on the MO instance.
Note! This attribute cannot be used for uniquely identifing the MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Enabled or disabled according to the actual operational state of the NCB board.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusEt
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled. The 'availabilityStatusEt' gives the availability status for the ET part of the NCB board.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusTu
attribute.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled. The 'availabilityStatusTu' gives the availability status for the Timing Unit part of the NCB board.

relationship.name: PlugInUnit_to_ManagedObject
relationship.description: This containment relation indicated that any kind of board may be used to specilize PlugInUnit.

relationship.name: SccpScrc_to_SccpApLocal
relationship.description:
The SccpApLocal represents a local SSN, no relation exists to an Mtp3bAp
Of the possible 216 SccpAps allowed on a node, a maximum of 16 are allowed to be local, and a maximum of 200 are allowed to be remote.
